loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is 42 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has no dependents. Ofelia earns a living by selling various items in her grocery store. She's been in the business for 10 years, and earns about PHP 6,000 per month by doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy additional groceries and other products to sell. Ofelia has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, she hopes to expand her sari sari (or variety) store business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries and other items to sell.

loans.name: Amelia Cecilia

texts.es:
Amelia es una mujer de 30 años de edad, mujer cabeza de familia que quiere salir adelante y luchar por un mejor futuro para ella y su hija, se dedica a la venta de mercancía como ropa, accesorios, cosméticos, gracias a estos ingresos ayuda en el hogar el cual mantiene, ella paga arriendo, servicios, públicos, alimentación, la cuidada de su hijo, una mujer que se esfuerza demasiado para conseguir los recursos diarios.


Amelia sueña con comprar una vivienda propia, comprar un carro para pasear con su hija, quiere tener un local propio para compartir tiempo con su amada criatura.

Amelia diariamente se enfrenta con las problemáticas barriales, los problemas de inclusión social de la zona, la fuerte competencia, pero solo ella sabe lo mucho que labora para que cada tarde que vuelve reciba a su hija con un fuerte abrazo y un alimento.

Amelia quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de ropa juvenil para hombre y dama, cosméticos (principalmente barnice) y accesorios para dama, bisutería en acero entre otros.
texts.en:
Amelia, 30, is a female head of household who wishes to get ahead and struggles for a better future for her and her daughter.  She makes a living from the sale of merchandise such as clothing, accessories, and cosmetics.  Thanks to this income, it helps in the home she maintains.  She pays for rent, public services, food, and childcare.  She is a woman who forces herself greatly to get the daily resources.
Amelia dreams of buying her own residence and buying a car to drive around in with her daughter.  She wants to have her own place where she can spend time with her much-loved baby.
Amelia confronts the neighborhood problems daily, problems of social inclusion in the zone and strong competition.  But only she knows how hard she works in order to return each evening and receive her daughter with a big hug and a meal.
Amelia would like to request a loan in order to buy an assortment of young people's clothing for men and women, cosmetics (principally nail polish) and accessories for women, steel jewelry amongst other things.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of young people's clothing for men and women, cosmetics (principally nail polish) and accessories for women, steel jewelry amongst other things.

loans.name: Samaila Mohammad

texts.en:
Samaila Mohammad is a Babban Gona farmer from Kaza Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm.

Since joining Babban Gona, Samaila Mohammad no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top-of-the-line farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, which is double the national average in Nigeria. This will allow him to increase his income considerably.

This season Samaila Mohammad has ambitious plans to harvest 30 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Samaila Mohammad now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To increase his crop yield by purchasing additional farm inputs

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Samba est celui à droite tenant dans sa main la corde attaché au bœuf. 
Samba  est un emboucheur de bœuf âgé de 47ans ; il est marié, père de cinq enfants dont trois garçons et deux filles. Les enfants n’ont pas été à l’école ; leur âge  varie entre 25 ans et 3 ans. Sa conjointe  est une vendeuse de lait ; le rêve de l’emprunteur est de construire une maison à Kati et avoir beaucoup de troupeau. Il réside  au Mali et il est analphabète. Pour pouvoir réalisé tous ses rêves il a eu des problèmes de fonds, tout en faisant une demande de prêts  au près du RMCR en vue d’acheter plus de bœufs, il achète ses bœufs dans les foires de la localité et après avoir  les embouchés, il les vend dans les mêmes foires locales   tout en réalisant un bénéfice prévisionnel de   50 000F. Ce bénéfice    lui permet de couvrir les frais médicaux  et les frais de nourritures des enfants  .il n’a pas eu de problème dans son activité d’embouche.
texts.en:
Samba is the one holding the rope attached to the steer. He is a livestock farmer of cattle. He is 47 years old and a married father of five children (3 boys and 2 girls). The children have not been to school; their ages range from 3 to 25. His wife is a milk vendor. 

This borrower’s dream is to build a house in Kati and to have a large herd. He resides in Mali and is illiterate. In realizing all his dreams, he has had funding problems as he takes out a loan from RMCR with the aim of purchasing cattle. He purchases his cattle at the fairs in his town. After fattening them, he sells them at the same local fairs, for a projected profit of 50,000 francs. The profit enables him to cover medical and food expenses for his children. He has not had any problems in his livestock business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell later

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia had the skills and expertise in "polvoron" making, yet she had no capital to make it for business. As a widow from Sindangan, she never gets tired of working to earn an income. Lilia joined PMPC after she learned she could gain financial assistance and she decided to start a business, which is "polvoron" making. It has been doing well as she has worked to perfect the taste and quality of her product. Lilia has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

She has requested another loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw ingredients for her business. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and continue to benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for her polovoron making business

loans.name: Maria Leonza

texts.es:
María, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar agujas, guardacabos, hilos de seda y de nylon para elaborar hamacas y cortinas, sus demandas son más grandes por lo que la cantidad de material que ha adquiere con las ganancias no es suficientes para suplicarlas.
María está satisfecha por los buenos resultados que ha tenido al invertir créditos en su negocio, tiene nuevos clientes, los ingresos han mejorado mucho y los utiliza para cancelar sus deudas, darle mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud a su familia.
texts.en: María needs a new loan to buy needles, thimbles, silk and nylon threads to make hammocks and curtains. Her demands are greater so the amount of material she buys with her profits is not enough to meet them. María is satisfied by the good results that she has had investing loans in her business. She has new customers and her income has improved significantly. She uses it to cancel her debts, provide better food, clothing, and health to her family.

loans.use: buy needles, thimbles, silk and nylon threads to make hammocks and curtains.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, who is married, is making a profit through her sari-sari (general store) store business. She is 53 years old. She never gets tired of tending her store. Her passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her family. Rosa is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default. 

Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and sales. Rosa continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and sales

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a widow from Lopez Jaena. She joined PMPC, in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. 

Recently, she accessed her third loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 for additional working capital, to buy a variety of grocery items for her existing business, where she sells a variety of food and non-food products to the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items for her existing business, which sells a variety of food and non-food products in the local community

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn has a fish vending business, helping the family survive. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from her earnings. 

Jenelyn hopes to provide her family with safe and comfortable living quarters, so she requested a loan to purchase cement and hollow blocks to start renovating her house. Jenelyn wishes to earn more from her business to continually benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase cement and hollow blocks to start renovating her house

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the necessary capital to start up a sari-sari store (small grocery) business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Alma has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. 

She wanted to take advantage of this good fortune, so, recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and sauces. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil and sauces

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 36 years old, is married with three children and lives in Oroquieta, Philippines. Juliet is managing her fishing business and has a small fish pond. She earns a good income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of her family, especially her children's education and health needs. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase 100 liters of diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and maintain other fishing equipment. In the future, Juliet  hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase 100 liters of diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and maintain other fishing equipment

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 69 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 1 child  who is now an adult.
Dioscora earns a living from her mini grocery store and has been operating this business for almost 40 years. She is also receiving monthly pension as a surviving spouse.  She earns approximately PHP5, 000.00 each month. This amount is so helpful to meet her needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable goods for retail.
Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Dioscora hopes to expand her mini grocery store business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable goods

loans.name: Christine Joy

texts.en:
Christine Joy, 24, is single and lives in Aloran, in the Philippines. She runs and manages a small eatery and has had this business for two years. Christine Joy has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more meat, spices, other raw ingredients and cooking utensils. This will help her to cook more dishes and be able to serve more local community members. Christine Joy wishes to earn more from her business to continually help her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat, spices, other raw ingredients and cooking utensils; to cook more dishes and be able to serve more local community members

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel and her husband are both farmers. As a member of PMPC, she is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. Liezel hopes to live comfortably in a decent house. 

She has applied for a loan of PHP30,000 to purchase bags of cement, loads of sand and additional roof sheets to finish her house. Liezel hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that her loan request has been given priority as a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful that all her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, loads of sand and additional roof sheets to finish her house

loans.name: Alaida

texts.en:
Alaida is from Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay, in the Philippines. She and her husband have a livestock business. They raise pigs and goats for sale. 

Recently, Alaida requested a loan to build cages for her goats and pigs. Alaida deeply wishes to save enough money for future emergencies. She hopes to open a shop in town.

loans.use: to build cages for her goats and pigs

loans.name: Siguidya Group

texts.fr:
Dramane N’ piè est la personne au bout tenant dans sa main la corde attaché au bœuf.
 Agé de 47 ans marié père de 10 enfants  dont l’âge est compris entre 20 à 07 ans, tous ses enfants sont scolarisés .Dramane N’piè n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, il fait l’élevage de bœufs, sa conjointe fait le ménage à la maison. Pour une meilleur gestion de son activité d’élevage de bœufs, Dramane N’piè fut confronter à quelques soucis financiers  il fait recourt au prêt du RMCR, cet appui financier lui a permet de générer plus de gains et d’augmenter son capital d’investissement et le profit serve à assurer les besoins de sa famille dans plusieurs domaines (la santé, l’éducation, le revêtement).
Sa source d’approvisionnement  en bœufs est  les foires locales et après avoir  les élevés, il les revend dans les mêmes foires à des prix qui lui permettent d’avoir  un profit  qui se varie entre 50000 à 75000f par cycle de prêts. Il est confronté souvent à quelques soucis sur le marché tel que la chute des prix,  son rêve   est   d’être indépendant  un jour du prêt du RMCR.
texts.en:
Dramane N’piè in the person on the end and holding the steer’s rope. He is 47 years old and a married father of ten children, aged 7 to 20, of whom all are in school. Dramane N’piè did not have the chance to go to school. He raises cattle. His wife is a homemaker. 

To do better at managing his livestock business, Dramane N’piè, turned to a loan from RMCR, since he is confronted with a few financial worries. This financial support enables him to generate more profit and to increase his investment capital. The profit is used to ensure his family’s needs are met in several domains (healthcare, education, clothing). 

His source of supplies of cattle is the local fairs. After raising the cattle, he resells them at the same fairs at prices enabling him to make a profit from 5,000 to 7,500 francs per loan cycle. He is often confronted with several market worries, such as a drop in prices. His dream is to be independent of RMCR loans one day.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and then sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works raising pigs in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. This is how she makes a living and supports her family. Rosalina’s lowest point was when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to access credit to support her business. 

Rosalina takes her PMPC membership as seriously as she does her business. She loaned an amount to purchase bags of gestation feeds for her pigs. In the future, she hopes to build a concrete pig pen to improve sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gestation feeds for her pigs

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie busies herself with selling assorted products. She is able to support her husband with providing for their daily needs and the education of their four children. Jovie sells cosmetics, lingerie, clothing apparel and beauty and health products to the local community. She wants to expand her business to purchase more inventory to sell. 

She has reached out to Paglaum MPC for funding needs and applied for a loan of 30,000 PHP. She is happy to earn in her own per month. She hopes to open an outlet store in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es:
Germán es un hombre de 62 años de edad que inicio en el año 1999 un negocio de parqueadero de motocicletas, por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, este negocio le ha servido para mantener a su familia conformada por 5 hijos, su pareja y para generar 2 empleos.

Su negocio al momento de abrirse tenía un objetivo el cual era mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y hasta el momento lo ha logrado pues gozan de un techo, buena alimentación  de una empresa firme que se proyecta a mejorar y ampliarse.

Germán se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales como concreto, madera, acero, metal para realizar mejoras locativas y ampliar su espacio para albergar mayor número de motocicletas.
texts.en:
Germán is a 69 year old man who in the year 1999 started a business, a motorcycle parkade because of his desire to work independently. This business has served to maintain his family made up of 5 children and his wife. Plus he has created two jobs.

At the time of opening his business he had the objective of improving the living conditions of his family. And up to this time he has manged to provide a roof for them and good food from a solid business that looks to improve and grow.

Germán is requesting a loan to buy materials like, cement, wood, steel and metal to make improvement on the his location and expand the space to house a greater number of motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy materials like, cement, wood, steel and metal to make improvement on the his location and expand the space to house a greater number of motorcycles.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina has started her small time business and became a boss with banana cue vending. She has manage to have enough inventories and rolls over her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she made good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. 

Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: To buy bananas, sugar, oil for banana cue vending

loans.name: Elmer Andres

texts.es:
Andres es un hombre trabajador, honorable, amistoso que tiene un negocio de salsamentaría, vende licores, refrescos, frituras, dulces, chocolates, en su negocio los principales clientes son personas mayores de edad que disfrutan un buen trago acompañado de su música favorita y Andres procurara darles un buen ambiente, donde no solo disfruten de una bebida o música si  no que también tenga juegos de mesas para su diversión.

Generar empleo, ser competitivo, expandir su local fueron sus objetivos desde que abrió el negocio, no ha podido lograr alguno pero trabaja fuertemente para que su negocio sea prospero y permita lograr los sueños que tiene para su familia como comprar vivienda, o uno simple de vivir mejor.

Andres solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con licor, comprara cerveza, aguardiente, ron, tequila, whisky que son los productos de mayor rotación en su negocio,
texts.en:
Andres is a hard-working, honorable, and friendly man who has a deli business.  He sells liquor, soft drinks, fried foods, sweets, and chocolates.  In his business, the main customers are adults who enjoy a good drink accompanied by their favorite music.  Andres seeks to give them a good environment where they can not only enjoy a drink or music, but also which has board games for their enjoyment.

His objectives when he opened the business were to generate employment, to be competitive, and to expand his property.  He has not been able to achieve these goals, but he works hard to make his business thrive and achieve the dreams that he has for his family, such as to buy a house or simply to live better.  

Andres is requesting a loan to stock his business with liquor.  He will buy beer, brandy, rum, tequila, and whiskey, which are the products with the highest turnover in his business.

loans.use: to stock his business with liquor, including beer, brandy, rum, tequila, and whiskey, which are the products with the highest turnover in his business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 35 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rowena has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of clothing to resell.

Rowena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Nayid

texts.es: Nelson de 36 años en su negocio de ebanistería cuenta con veinte años de experiencia, este arte lo aprendió gracias a su padre quien también se dedica a esta misma actividad y desde niño en su taller le permitió diseñar y elaborar puertas y ventanas.  Todos los días a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., sus clientes pueden dirigirse al taller y escoger diseños de su preferencia, en su gran mayoría son habitantes del municipio de Chocontá donde se encuentra ubicado el taller y por su popularidad y buen nombre acceden a realzar sus trabajos con toda confianza.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de materias primas; madera, pegamento, pinturas, y demás, para cumplir oportunamente con la entrega de unos pedidos a sus clientes.  Su principal desafío para alcanzar sus metas será cumplir con sus obligaciones financieras y de negocio. A largo plazo espera mejorar su productividad.
texts.en:
Nelson is 36 years old and has 20 years of experience in his cabinetmaking business. He learned this art thanks to his father who was also a cabinetmaker and allowed Nelson to design and make doors and windows in his shop since he was a child.

Every day at 9 a.m. until 5 p.m. his customers can go to his workshop and select designs of their choice. The vast majority of them are from the town of Choconta which is where the shop is located. Because of his popularity and good reputation they come to the shop to admire his work with complete confidence. 

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he will invest the money in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, glue, paint, etc. so that he can deliver his clients' orders on time. His main challenges in reaching his goals are meeting his financial obligations and his business obligations. Long-term he hopes to improve his productivity.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood, glue, paint, and others.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina, 53, is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. For the past five years she has been preparing and selling food in the Philippines to earn a living.

Victorina has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to buy more ingredients with which to make her food. She is working diligently to make enough money to develop her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients with which to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Ratnawati

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratnawati has a family of two and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mrs. Ratnawati heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe-water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Ratnawati who is also a healthworker in her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. 

Mrs. Ratnawati will use this loan to buy about 20 filters and sell them to her neighbors on credit, making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 59 years old and widowed with eight children. For the past 39 years she has operated her sari-sari, or general store in the Philippines.

Flora took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF and is now requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more stock to sell to her customers. She is working hard to be able to develop her shop further.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 37 years old, married and has six children, five of whom are currently in school. For the past 21 years she has worked steadily running her sari-sari, or general store in the Philippines.

Jacqueline has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more groceries to sell, such as candies, canned goods, shampoo, noodles, detergent, soap, cooking oil, etc. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her shop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Josel is 21 years old and is studying to achieve his bachelor of science in industrial technology degree, a 4-year course. 

Jocelyn, Josel's mother, needs PHP 6,035 to pay for her son's tuition fee for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, Josel plans to be gainfully employed so he can help to improve the quality of life of his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 52 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lourdes has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.  She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie works hard to support her family. Josie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Josie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Josie has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 28 years old and married with two children. 

Joy is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Joy requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Joy has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Joy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 41 years old and married with one child. Judelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Judelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Judelyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, milk, and noodles. 

Judelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 44 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jonalyn has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Sovann is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 29 years old and lives in  a wooden house with one floor with her husband, her 4-year-old son and her sister, who is studying in high school. Her family owns 6 hectares of rice fields and 2.5 hectares of cassava fields. In 2002 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. 

Sovann makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. Today she makes around eight scarves per week, as she is fast and experienced. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom-preparation-related fees

loans.name: Chandet

texts.en:
Chandet is 21 years old, a single staff at a micro finance institution, and he is also a student at a university in the city. He is from the Pursat province, Cambodia. He has worked in the city since 2014, earning approximately $7 a day. 

Currently, Chandet is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in law at a university in the city.

Because of a lack of financial support, Chandet would like to request a loan to pay for his third-year tuition fee. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and go through the third year successfully. 

His dream is to have a proper job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay for his third-year tuition fee

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 66 years old and widowed with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lida runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Lida has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Lida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 36 years old and married with five children, all of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For 13 years, Emeralda has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, soft-drinks, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell.

In the future, Esmeralda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her general store.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Juliet has been in this business for 10 years now.

Juliet requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Larina

texts.en:
Larina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Larina is 50 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Larina has a sewing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Larina has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stock like slippers, sandals, blankets, etc. to sell for her business selling dry goods.

Laura has been in this business for 21 years. Laura earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Laura has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock like slippers, sandals, blankets, etc. to sell

loans.name: Habu

texts.en: Habu is a Babban Gona farmer from Kyasge Village. Habu joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Habu will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Habu would like to use his extra earnings to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Sokorm

texts.en:
Sokorm is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 21 years old and lives in a wooden one floor house with her relatives. Her family owns 2 hectares of rice fields. 

In 2014 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sokorm makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for the fertilizer for the fields. 

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Marietes

texts.en:
Mark Kevin is 21 years old and is first of the three children in the family. His mother, Marietes, is a member of NWTF; she supports the family through her livestock raising business in the Philippines.

Mark Kevin is studying for a bachelor of science in nautical and is in a 4-year course.

Marietes is borrowing PHP 24,000 to pay the tuition fee of her son Mark Kevin for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, Mark Kevin plans to be gainfully employed so he could help improve the quality of life of his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 27 years old, married and has two grade-school children. In order to help give their children a comfortable way of living, Hazel's husband decided to work abroad. Her husband now is working abroad as welder. With her desire to help her husband in supporting their family's needs, Hazel engaged in the vending business. She is also managing their vulcanizing shop in their village. During harvesting season, Hazel also sells street foods like barbecue within their village. 

Hazel is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tools to use in repairing wheels of vehicles. She will also use the loan to buy additional meat and ingredients for her barbecue business. She hopes to extend the business and get a larger income for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy tools to use in repairing wheels of vehicles.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Analiza goes fishing. She sells fresh fish to earn a living. She has seven children. Her oldest child is 19 and the youngest is 3. Her husband is a fisherman. She is the one who sells her husband's catch. She has been engaged in fishing for 20 years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net, rope, floater and paint for the boat renovation. These will help improve her yield and enable her to sell more fish. Thus, her income will improve and she will be able to settle her obligations. She could provide healthy meals to the whole family and able to expand her fishing business. 

Analiza dreams of managing her business to be successful and to be able to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, rope, floater and paint for the boat renovation

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. 

She is requesting a loan through NWTF in order to purchase more materials like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business.

Felicidad has been in this business for 3 years. She also earns additional income from a general store.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Felicidad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina works hard to support her family. Ma. Magdalina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Magdalina requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like detergent soap, cereals, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell.

Ma. Magdalina has been in this business for five years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Magdalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like detergent soap, cereals, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonila is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Leonila has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Leonila has been in this business for five years. In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilibeth is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lilibeth has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell to her customers.

Lilibeth has been in this business for four years. Lilibeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 61 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercedes is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mercedes has been raising pigs for 14 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marites has been in this business for 26 years now.

Marites requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 52 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Irene has been in this business for seven years and also earns additional income from farming.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Melissa has a selling purchase order cards business in the Philippines. Melissa requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Melissa has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria Enidia

texts.es:
Trabajar por el futuro de sus hijos es la principal fuente de fuerza que tiene la señora María una persona humilde, cariñosa, entregada a su familia que lucha diariamente en sus maquinas de confección por bordar una mejor calidad de vida.

María inicio su negocio por decisión y superación personal, esas ganas de superarse y de ser una gran empresaria son su principal carta para conseguir contratos dado que el empeño y delicadeza que pone en sus trabajos la hacen acreedora de una fama de buena calidad en su negocio.

María quiere mejorar sus tiempos de producción, ampliar la capacidad de su negocio por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina fileteadora.
texts.en:
Working for the future of her children is the main source of strength that María has, a humble and loving person, devoted to her family, who struggles daily in her tailoring sewing machines to embroider a better quality of life.

María started her business by choice and personal growth. That desire to excel and be a great entrepreneur are her main card to get contracts, since the effort and gentleness that she puts on her work make her worthy of a reputation of good quality in her business.

Mary wants to improve her production times and increase the capacity of her business; because of it, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of a serging machine.

loans.use: to buy a serging machine.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Lili  village. Dahiru joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dahiru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.  This season, Dahiru  has grand plans to harvest 55 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dahiru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en:
Jenelie is 26 years old and married with one child in school.

Jenelie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Jenelie has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from a cafeteria.

Jenelie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alexey

texts.en:
Alexey is married and has two children. He has his own small business.

Alexey has been selling clothes at the market for 16 years. He has two sales spots. The most popular products are t-shirts. Alexey is a responsible and honest person. During the autumn and winter seasons he had bad sales because of the Ukrainian currency devaluation. Due to his hard work and wise money management he passed the hardest period. 

Alexey is asking for a loan of 15,000 UAH to increase the assortment of men's summer clothes. 

He hopes to get additional income by selling more inventory during this summer season.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of men's summer clothes

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear. Lydia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, needles, thread, buttons, etc. for her tailoring business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, needles, thread, buttons, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food-vending business.

Ma. Gina has been in this business for 10 years. Ma. Gina earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Gnongondeme Group

texts.fr:
SIAKA est la personne qui tient la corde de bœuf sur la photo, il est emboucheur âgé de 41 ans au Mali où il habite avec sa femme et ses 8 enfants âgés de 9 mois à 18 ans. Parmi ses enfants trois fréquentent l’école.                                                                                                                                                      
Il pratique son activité d’emboucheur depuis plus de 8 ans, il achète ses bœufs dans le marché de sa localité et après avoir engraissé ses animaux il les vend dans le marché local. Avec les autres membres sur la photo, ils exercent le même métier d’emboucheur. Ils ont constitué un groupe de solidarité de 6 membres pour prendre un prêt auprès du RMCR.                                                                                                                                                                           Avec ce prêt, son rêve dans l’avenir  est de conquérir les grands marchés de bétail de la ville.  Ce prêt l’aide à répondre à l’autosuffisance alimentaire ainsi que la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
Siaka is the one holding a cattle  rope in the photo. He is a cattlle farmer. He is 41 years old, born in Mali, where he now lives with his wife and eight children ranging from nine months to 18 years of age. Three of his children go to school.

Siaka has been raising cattle for over eight years. He buys cattle at the local market for fattening and resale at the same market. The other group members in the photo also raise livestock. They belong to a six-member borrowers group formed in order to request a solidarity loan from RMCR.
With this loan, Siaka hopes to establish himself at the main livestock markets in his town. This loan will allow him to provide for his family's food as well as his children's healthcare.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda, aged 48, is a married woman with six children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Merlinda has had a rug-making business in the Philippines for the past four years. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Merlinda has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her rug-making business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her rug-making business

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle, aged 40, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Michelle has had a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines for the past three years. 

Michelle has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina, aged 49, is a married woman with five children aged 14-24. She has run a sari-sari (variety) store for the past three years.  She sells goods ranging from noodles, canned goods, biscuits, chips and condiments through to toiletries and beverages.  

Avelina is requesting a loan to buy rice, soft drinks and assorted goods to sell. These will fill her store with various stocks which will attract customers. With these goods to sell, her daily income will increase and she will be able to pay her obligations. Therefore, this will enable Avelina to provide her children with good food and better shelter in which to live.

With additional capital, Avelina would like to improve her small store so it will be sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks and assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila, aged 48, is married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines, which she has been doing for the past five years. 

Nila has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Nila would like to save enough money so she can  afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hard-working entrepreneur with three children. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as her charcoal retailing business.

Gina has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita, aged 56, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who, for the past four years, has had a sewing business in the Philippines. 

Pablita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is 53 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, which she has been doing for the past five years. 

Restituta has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Restituta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en:
Rodora is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a general store business in the Philippines for the past 13 years.

Rodora successfully repaid her previous loan. She has now requested a new loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to further build her business. She will use this loan to purchase additional grocery items such as canned goods, bread, coffee, juice, sanitary pads, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

In the future, Rodora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items such as canned goods, bread, coffee, juice, sanitary pads, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita, aged 41, is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Rosalita has run a general store in the Philippines for the past five years and also earns an income from electronic mobile phone load retailing.

Rosalita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of grocery items to sell in her general store.

Rosalita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor tiene 37 años de edad y es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 12 años se dedica a la elaboración de estructuras metálicas, actividad que realiza en su vivienda, lo que le permite sostener la economía de su familia. Víctor vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 8 años de edad que son su mayor alegría. Víctor desea invertir en herramientas que le permitan realizar mejor su trabajo y de esta manera mejorar los ingresos económicos de su hogar, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: aparato de soldadura eléctrica, pulidora, tenazas y taladro para mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Víctor is 37, a hard-working man who has been a metalworker for 12 years, a business he runs from his home and which allows him to support his family. 

Víctor lives with his life companion and his eight-year-old daughter, who are his greatest joy.

Víctor wishes to buy tools which will allow him to do his work better and this way improve his household income.  For this reason he is requesting a loan from Fusai so that he can invest in an electric welder, polisher, tongs and a drill, in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase an electric welder, polisher, tongs and a drill, in order to improve his business.

loans.name: Yarli Albenia

texts.es:
Yarli es una persona que tiene todas las ganas de progresar y de ser alguien en la vida, cansada de ser solo una ama de casa busca un apoyo para iniciar un negocio de venta de repuesto de bicicletas, ya que en su barrio es muy común este medio de transporte.

Yarli tiene un motivo muy grande pro el cual luchar, ver sus 6 hijos estudiando es lo que le llena de entusiasmo para trabajar y darles una mejor calidad de vida es su meta de ahora en adelante.

Yarli quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de los repuesto más buscados, como lo son parches, neumáticos, llantas, pastas de frenos, cables de frenos, manubrios y sillines.
texts.en:
Yarli is a person who is extremely motivated to get ahead and be someone in life. Tired of being merely a housewife, she is looking for help to start a business selling bicycle parts, as this is a very common means of transportation in her neighborhood.

Yarli has a very big reason for which to continue fighting: seeing her 6 children studying fills her with enthusiasm to work, and giving them a better quality of life is her goal from now on.

Yarli requests a loan to purchase an assortment of the most popular bicycle parts, such as patches, tires, wheels, brake pads, brake cables, and seats.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of the most sought after bicycle parts, such as patches, tires, wheels, brake pads, brake cables, and seats.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Agée de 27 ans, Ayawa est une femme mariée. Ayawa est mère de deux enfants et habite dans le quartier d’Adakpamé. Ayawa vend des friperies dans son quartier. Ayawa réalise un revenu grâce à son activité pour aider ses enfants. Ayawa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des slips, des chaussures et des soutiens, Ayawa demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: At 27 years old, Ayawa is a married woman. Ayawa is the mother of two and lives in the neighborhood of Adakpamé. Ayawa sells used clothing in her neighborhood. Ayawa earns money thanks to her business to help her children. Ayawa stocks up once a month at the market. In order to place an order for underwear, shoes, and bras, Ayawa is asking for this loan to reach her goals and to earn a good profit.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen pairs of underwear, 12 pairs of shoes, and 5 dozen bras

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 48 ans qui vit à Bè avec ses huit enfants. Pour contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille, Akossiwa vend de la bouillie qu’elle prépare à l’aide du mil accompagnée des beignets dans son quartier. Akossiwa s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès des fournisseurs du quartier pour disposer en permanence ses ingrédients. Pour acheter des bols de mil et des beignets, Akossiwa demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et développer favorablement son activité pour avoir plus de rentabilité
texts.en: Akossiwa is a married, 48-year-old woman who lives in Bè with her eight children. To help her family thrive,  Akossiwa sells porridge that she makes from millet with donuts in her neighborhood. Akossiwa stocks up once a month from neighborhood suppliers to always have her ingredients on hand. To buy bowls of millet and donuts, Akossiwa is asking for this loan to finance her purchase and to favorably develop her business to have more profitability.

loans.use: to buy 60 bowls of millet and 40 donuts

loans.name: Omolayo

texts.fr: Très dynamique et active, Omolayo est une femme mariée âgée de 33 qui vit à Adidogomé. Omolayo est mère de trois enfants et travaille pour leur épanouissement. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Omolayo est une coiffeuse qui vend des mèches afin d’avoir un revenu nécessaire pour leur survie. Omolayo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des mèches, Omolayo demande ce crédit pour réaliser ses objectifs et avoir une plus grande rentabilité pour aider sa famille.
texts.en: Very energetic and active, Omolayo is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Adidogomé. Omolayo is a mother of three and works to support them. In order to make ends meet, Omolayo is a hairstylist who sells hair extensions in order to earn the necessary revenue for their survival. Omolayo stocks up twice a month at the market. To buy hair extensions, Omolayo is seeking this loan to fulfill her objectives and to have more profitability to help her family.

loans.use: to buy 60 hair extensions

loans.name: Boassa 01 Group

texts.fr: Colette, membre représentatif est la responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Cette jeune dame âgée de 29 ans vend des céréales depuis 4 ans. Elle va acheter sa marchandise à 100 kg de Ouagadougou. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour aller acheter du mil rouge pour vendre. après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra d'aider son époux a faire les dépenses de la maison et aussi de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Colette is the superviser and representative member of the group. She is married and the mother of three children. This young lady of 29 years of age has sold cereals for four years. She heads out to buy her merchandise 100kms from Ouagadougou. She requires this loan in order to go and buy red meal to sell.
As a result of these sales, her profits will enable her to help her husband to meet the family's expenses, and also to carry on her business.

loans.use: to buy thirty sacks of red meal to sell.

loans.name: Nientaton Group

texts.fr:
Bakary est celui qui porte le képi et  tient la tête du  bœuf par devant en rien sur la photo
Il est âgé e 37 ans. Bakary a 03 enfants en charge dont l’un écolier. Bakary fait l’embouche de bœuf depuis quelques années. L’embouche permet à Bakary de prendre sa famille en charge. Il s’endette auprès du RMCR pour améliorer son embouche bovine. Bakary est très courageux et respectueux.
il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Bakary revend ses bœufs après quelques mois d’entretien en nourriture et soin vétérinaire,dans mêmes marchés locaux. Il souhaite construire une maison en dur pour sa famille
texts.en:
Bakary is the man wearing a cap and holding the cow's head forwards while laughing in the photo. He is 37 years old. Bakary has three children, one of whom attends primary school. Bakary has been a cattle rearer for several years. Cattle rearing allows him to take care of his family. He borrows funds from RMCR in order to improve his operation. He is very dynamic and respectful.
He buys his supplies in the local markets. Bakary resells his cattle after several months feeding them and ensuring veterinary care for them; he sells them in the same local markets.
He hopes to build a stone house for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 39 ans, Essi est mère de deux enfants et habite dans le quartier de Baguida  pour exercer ses activités. Essi vend des friperies dans le quartier afin de trouver son bénéfice et satisfaire agréablement ses besoins quotidiens. Essi s’approvisionne une fois au marché pour disposer de son stock. Dans le souci de commander des pantalons et des chemises, Essi demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer une marge bénéficiaire pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Married and 39 years old, Essi is a mother of two and lives in the neighborhood of Baguida to run her business. Essi sells used clothing in the neighborhood in order to make a living and to adequately satisfy her daily needs. Essi stocks up once a month at the market to manage her stock. With the worry of ordering pants and shirts, Essi is asking for this loan to fulfill this purchase and to earn a profit to support her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 225 pairs of pants and 150 shirts

loans.name: Rocky's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis juillet 2011,rassemble des membres qui sont issus du même village et ont comme activité principale l'agriculture.

Seynabou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elles est mariée ,est âgée de 43 ans et a 04 enfants dont 02 garçons.

Son activité consiste à pratiquer l'agriculture durant la période d'hivernage.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 100 kg d'arachide  pour une somme de 50000f et 02 sacs d'engrais pour une valeur de 10000f le sac.  

les bénéfices issus de cette culture lui permette de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011 and comprises members from the same village who all work in agriculture as their main business. Seynabou, on the right in the photo with her arm raised, is the group representative. She is married, 43 years old and the mother of two boys and two girls. Her business is farming during the winter period.
With this loan, she intends to buy 100 kgs of peanut for a price of 50,000F and two sacks of fertiliser for 10,000F each. The profits generated from this crop will enable her to pay the family's living expenses and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy meal and peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy lining with which to make clothes to sell and also fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Dédé est une femme qui a trois enfants à sa charge. Habitant à Akodesséwa, Dédé est très dynamique et active pour assurer les charges quotidiennes. Dédé vend des articles d’occasion au Port de Lomé et réalise un revenu favorable. Dédé s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Dédé sollicite ce microcrédit pour acheter des fers à repasser, des plats et des sacs et avoir assez de profits pour promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: 39 years old, Dédé is a woman with three children. Living in Akodesséwa, Dédé is very dynamic and works hard to meet her daily expenses. She sells secondhand goods at the port of Lomé and makes a good income. Dédé buys her supplies twice a month at the market. She is seeking this micro-loan in order to buy irons, plates and bags, and to obtain enough profit to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 7 irons, 3 boxes of plates and 8 bags.

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants"diabe Thiallel" Group

texts.fr:
Épouses des enseignants groupement « Diabe Thiallel » regroupe cinq femmes qui s’activent dans le domaine du commerce et qui logent dans le même quartier. Elles viennent pour la première fois solliciter un crédit au niveau de l’IMCEC à travers un réseau de femme implanté dans la petite côte. 
La présidente du groupe s’appelle Marie Bernadette, elle est âgée de 44 ans, célibataire et mère d’un garçon de 25 ans. Elle évolue dans le commerce de fruits de mer et de poisson frais où elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 5 ans. Avec ce crédit, elle va pouvoir augmenter la quantité des produits : produits halieutiques et poisson frais pour revendre à sa clientèle.
Marie Bernadette souhaite acheter sa propre maison et améliorer davantage son activité.
texts.en: A group of teachers’ wives, Diabe Thiallel groups together five women who are in the same business and live in the same neighborhood. They are seeking their first loan with IMCEC through a network of women established in the small coast. The president of the group is named Marie Bernadette. She is 44, single, and a mother to a 25-year-old boy. She has been in the seafood and fresh fish business for more than 5 years. With this loan, she is going to be able to augment the quantity of her products:  fishing products and fresh fish to sell to customers. Marie Bernadette wishes to buy her own house and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seafood and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans et mère de deux enfants. Abla vit à Bè pour entreprendre son activité. Abla vend de la salade et du spaghetti préparé pour la restauration de ses clients afin de gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Abla s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Abla demande ce crédit pour acheter des spaghettis, des plateaux d’œufs, et laitues et des bouteilles de mayonnaise afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abla is a 44 year old married woman, and the mother of two children. She lives in Bè from where she runs her business. Abla sells salad and a spaghetti dish to feed her customers, in order to earn her living and support her family.
Abla buys her supplies twice a month at the market. She is requesting this loan to buy spaghetti, eggs, lettuce and bottles of mayonnaise - this will allow her to make a profit and to help her husband with the household expenses, and to ensure the children have a good education.

loans.use: to buy ten packs of spaghetti, five boxes of eggs, six heads of lettuce and four bottles of mayonnaise.

loans.name: Gloria Nubia

texts.es:
Glria es una mujer de 40 años de edad con una bonita pero difícil historia, para ser resumidos; ella antes de tener su propio restaurante, empezó como empleada en u restaurante ganaba un salario normal que era suficiente para complementar los gastos de su hogar pues su ex marido genera el resto de capital, pero todo cambio una vez se separo, quedo como cabeza de familia con dos hijos y las cosas se ponían algo complicadas, pero su jefe le recomendó que iniciara su propio negocio que tenía todas las cualidades necesarias para hacerlo y hoy en día esta mujer tiene un restaurante con el cual genera los recursos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Ahora Gloria quiere solicitar un apoyo para empezar a crecer y expandirse, con el dinero solicitado comprara sillas, mesas, manteles, cubiertos, platos, surtido de carnes, abarrotes, vegetales, frutas, refrescos y cervezas.
texts.en:
Gloria, 40, has a nice but difficult past.  In summary: before she had her own restaurant she started out as an employee at a restaurant where she earned a normal salary which was enough to help pay household expenses since her ex-husband was covering the rest.  But it all changed when they got divorced, as she was left as head of household with two children and things began to get complicated.  Her boss encouraged her to start her own business since she had all the necessary skills to do so.  Now she has a restaurant and earns enough income to support her family.

Gloria is requesting support to grow and expand her business.  She will use the loan to buy chairs, tables, tablecloths, cutlery, dishes and a variety of meats, groceries, vegetables, fruits, soft drinks and beers.

loans.use: To expand her business and buy chairs, tables, tablecloths, cutlery, dishes, and a variety of meats, groceries, vegetables, fruits, soft drinks and beers.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en: Pedrita is 52 years old. She is married to a fisherman and they live in Lopez Jaena, Philippines. Pedrita manages her fishing business and owns a fishing boat. She has employed two fishermen to work for her. She personally sells the catch from her fishing boat to the market and neighboring towns. She earns a good income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of her family. She has requested a loan to restock liters of diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and overhaul, and purchase fishing equipment and accessories. In the future, Pedrita hopes to buy another fishing boat to earn more money and renovate her house.

loans.use: to restock liters of diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and overhaul, and purchase fishing equipment and accessories

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animal feed for his shrimp to earn more profit.

loans.name: Ruby Estrella

texts.en:
Ruby Estrella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Ruby Estrella requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell.

Ruby Estrella has been in this business for five years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Ruby Estrella would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 60 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Salome has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Salome has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Amira Hortensia

texts.es: Amira, se ha dedicado por muchos años a la venta mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, a través de los cuales promueve los artículos de su oferta; esta emprendedora mujer de 63 años,  ofrece a los habitantes del sector del barrio donde reside en el municipio de San Jacinto en el Departamento de Bolívar todo tipo de artículos y detalles, productos para el cuidado de la piel y el cabello, colonias y mercancías varias, también hamacas elaboradas por artesanos de su región. Aunque sus ventas se generan en su gran mayoría de contado, una estrategia para dinamizarlas es ofrecer facilidad de pago a sus clientes, así mismo sus proveedores ha mantenido la confianza que han depositado en ella al entregarle mercancía a crédito, sin embargo las compras de contado le permite ofrecer a la clientela mejor un precio.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancías varias; colonias, cremas y demás, ajustando su oferta a la demanda que muy pronto en temporada del día de los Padres, se incrementará y esto generará un mayor volumen de ventas, pues sus inventarios están a la medida de las solicitudes de compras.
texts.en:
Amira, 63, is an entrepreneur who has spent many years in sales using specialized catalogues and brochures.  Her customers are residents in the neighborhood where she lives in the municipality of San Jacinto in the department of Bolivar.  She sells all kinds of products and accessories, skin care and hair care products, colognes, and a variety of other goods.  She also sells hammocks made by artisans in her region.  Although most of the sales transactions are carried out in cash, one of her sales strategies is to offer easy payment terms to her customers needing credit.  Her suppliers also have confidence in her and deliver goods to her on credit.  But the goods she buys in cash allow her to offer her customers a lower price.

Amira is now applying for a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy a variety of goods: colognes, lotions and other items, so she can attend to demand for the Father's Day season.  Usually sales increase at this time and she wants to have stock on hand to fill orders.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods: colognes, lotions and other items.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 35 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Thelma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Thelma has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Valeria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy an additional unit of computer for her business.

Valeria has been in this business for 10 years. Valeria earns more income from her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Valeria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit of computer for her business

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
6 Son los hijos de la señora Juana por ello son 6 los motivos que tiene para iniciar una empresa de cría de cerdos apoyada de sus conocimientos que le trasmitieron sus padres, buscando generar una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor futuro para sus muchachos de 16, 14, 10, 6, 4, 1 año de edad los cuales merecen que ella de todo de sí para que tengan una vida plena y sin pasar necesidades.

Por tal motivo la señora Juana quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar su negocio y el dinero solicitado lo destinara en la compra de cerdos y  materiales para la construcción de cocheras.
texts.en:
Juana has six children who are her motivation to start a pig business with the skills she learned from her parents.  She wants to give her children a better quality of life and future.  They are 16, 14, 10, 6, 4 and 1 and deserve to have a full life and lack for nothing.

Therefore, Juana is requesting a loan to start her own business.  She will use the loan to buy pigs and materials to build a pen.

loans.use: To start a pig business.

loans.name: Saratu Ibrahim

texts.en: Saratu Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maimai Village. Saratu Ibrahim joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of her family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, she no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay her children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Saratu Ibrahim will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. With increased yields and incomes, Saratu Ibrahim has made it her ultimate goal to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 35 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Yvonne has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. Yvonne requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Yvonne has been in this business for five years. In the future, Yvonne would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juan Hernan

texts.es:
