Juan Hernán es un hombre del campo, trabajador, sencillo, una persona que empezó desde 0 y ahora tiene una muy buena empresa de cría y venta de cerdos la cual empezó con un bajo capital pero poco a poco ha ido creciendo viéndose su familia muy beneficiada debido a la calidad de vida que han ganando Gracias a Juan que trabaja diariamente 10 horas para brindar una buena estabilidad económica a su hogar.


La meta de Juan es un día poder comprar una vivienda propia y dejarle una buena herencia de negocio y terreno  sus tres hijos.


En la foto se puede apreciar la forma empírica en que Juan inicio su negocio pero ahora quiere cambiar esto por tal razón solicita una considerable suma de dinero que quiere invertir en la construcción de cocheras más amplias para sus cerdos, además de construir canales de desechos, canales de alimento y bebidas.
texts.en:
Juan Hernan is a hard-working, simple farmer who started his business from nothing.  He has a very good pig business which he began with only a small amount of capital and, little by little, has seen his family benefit through a better quality of life.  All thanks to Juan who works ten hours a day to provide his household with economic stability.

Juan's goal is to buy his own house and leave a good legacy - with a business and land - to his three children.

In the picture you can see how Juan has set up business on his own.  Now he wants to change this and is requesting a considerable amount of money to build larger pig pens.  He also wants to build sewage canals and feeding troughs.

loans.use: To build pig pens, sewage canals and feeding troughs.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette hails from the town of Loon, Bohol.  She is engaged in a hog-raising business. She raises and sells hogs. She is a 46-year-old married woman with three dependents who are 11, 14 and 16 years old, respectively. She has been raising hogs for nine years already. Her husband earns a living by being a janitor. 

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. With these, Bernadette will be able to raise good quality hogs and her income will improve. She will be able to handle her business and pay her obligations. With these, she will be able to continue to send her children to school and provide healthy diets to the whole family.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and putting up another source of income for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 55 years old and married with two children. 

Antonia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Antonia has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Antonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en: Umaru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tafida Village. Umaru joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Umaru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Umaru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Kumbuka Group

texts.fr: Michel a été scolarisé grâce à la culture de riz qu'exerçait ses parents. Il s'est lancé aussi dans cette activité en 1980. Malgré les maladies de plantes et l'insuffisance de fonds, il estime qu'il pourra étendre son champ; et une bonne production lui permettra sûrement de scolariser ses enfants et d'améliorer son habitat. Il est président du groupe KUMBUKA; sur photo, il tient un carnet rose. Au final, le groupe est composé de 3 personnes dont il est le seul homme. L'autre homme présent sur la photo a désisté à la dernière minute pour raison de maladie.
texts.en:
Michel was able to attend school thanks to the rice crops that his parents grew. He also embarked in this venture in 1980. In spite of plant diseases and insufficient funds, he believes he will be able to extend his field; and a good crop will probably allow him to school his children and improve his living conditions.
He is the president of the KUMBUKA group; in the photo, he holds a pink booklet. In the end, the group is made up of three persons of whom he is the only man. The other man present in the photograph withdrew at the last minute due to illness.

loans.use: to purchase weeding, fertilizer and crop protection products

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Ann has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. With the little time Ann has, she sells crops from their small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. 

From Kiva lenders, Ann is seeking a loan worth 40,000 KES to pay for seedlings in order to grow more crops. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, as evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Ann access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, Ann’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: La Promesse Group

texts.fr: Ali a appris de ses parents que la culture du riz était rentable par rapport à d'autres et cela leur permettaient de résoudre plusieurs problèmes familiaux, tels que la scolarisation, habitat et soins de santé. Quoiqu'il décrie les maladies de plantes et l'insuffisance de moyens financiers, il est confiant qu'une bonne récolte leur permettra d'améliorer ses conditions de vie et d'élargir son étendue culturale. Il préside le groupe LA PROMESSE et tient un carnet rose sur la photo.
texts.en: Ali learnt from his parents that the rice crop was more profitable compared to others and that this would help them resolve many family problems, such as schooling, living conditions and healthcare. Although he decries plant diseases and lack of financial resources, he is confident that a good harvest will allow him to improve his standard of living and to extend his crop field. He is the president of the LA PROMESSE group and holds a pink booklet in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy weeding and fertiliser products and pay labor for harvesting

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr: Talato est une femme de 43 ans mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle fait la restauration depuis plus de 20 ans et sa force c'est quelle utilise des produits frais et naturel. La réussite de cette brave dame c'est parce qu’elle varie les menus; écoute attentivement les remarques et les propositions des clients;elle est aussi a leurs petits soin. Talato est a son 03 crédits avec ACFIME et tous ce passe bien, elle rembourse aux dates convenues. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter du riz, du haricot, de l'huile, des condiments pour faire des menus diversifiés pour satisfaire ses clients. Après ses ventes, elle aura un  bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire de l'épargne mais aussi de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Talato is a 43-year old married woman and mother of 4 children. She has been in the restaurant business for over 20 years and her strength is that she uses fresh and natural products. This good lady's success is because she varies her menus, listens attentively to her clients' remarks and suggestions, and she also takes good care of them.
Talato is in her third credit cycle with ACFIME and it is going well; she makes her payments at the agreed dates. She needs this loan in order to buy rice, beans, oil and condiments to prepare diverse menus to satisfy her clients. After her sales, she will have a profit that will allow her to build her savings but also to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil and condiments to prepare and sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Kivete Group

texts.fr: L'initiative de se lancer dans la culture du riz est venue à l'esprit de Jules lors de la faillite de la Sucrerie de Kiliba où il était employé en tant que maçon. N'étant plus salarié, il s'est vite engagé dans la riziculture avec le peu de moyen qui lui restait dans le but de les fructifier afin de pouvoir nourrir, scolariser et soigner sa famille et cela depuis 1980. Avec son expérience de 35 ans dans cette activité, il éprouve beaucoup de difficultés financières mais projette et prétends réaliser une grande production au cas où il élargirait son espace cultural. Président du groupe KIVETTE, il tient sur la photo un carnet rose.
texts.en: The initiative to start growing rice crops came to Jules' mind during the bankruptcy of the Kiliba sugar factory where he was employed as a mason. No longer earning a salary, he quickly started rice cultivation with the little means that he still had left in order to multiply them so as to feed, school and care for his family, and this since 1980. With his 35 years' experience in this activity, he faces many financial hardships but looks forward to the future and hopes to realise a large crop production if he were to expand his field. President of the KIVETTE group, he holds a pink booklet in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy weeding, fertiliser and crop protection products

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tafida Village.

Kabiri joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Kabiru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Kabiru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 38, is a smallholder mixed farmer from the Nyamira area of Kenya who is married to a nice handsome husband. They have been blessed with five kids so far. She is very hardworking and focused. Her primary income sources today are milk, eggs, and maize, among other crops.

Jane is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. This expansion will help to enhance her family's financial security. The more hens she acquires, the more assets under her name and the more income she makes through egg sales. The hens will also bring other numerous benefits including chicks, manure and feathers. The income from this investment will enable Jane to take better care of her family and pay for her children's education.

Lend $25 to improve the quality of life of a wife, a mother, and a progressive lady farmer in the remote area of Nyamira.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Grupo Chuisanto Group

texts.es:
Diego (es el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de playera blanca) es un padre de familia que trabaja de sol a sol para darles lo mejor a su familia, él cuenta que gracias al apoyo del crédito él pudo darle el mantenimiento a sus plantaciones de banano y afortunadamente obtuvo muy buena cosecha y le dejo una buena ganancia con el que pudo comprar una cuerda de terreno, Diego ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para darle mantenimiento a las plantaciones de café.
Diego y su grupo esperan contar nuevamente con el crédito para seguir prosperando y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
Diego (the first one on the left in the picture in the white t-shirt) is a father who works from sunrise to sunset to provide the best for his family. Thanks to the help from the previous loan, he was able to maintain his banana plantations. Fortunately, he had a very good harvest that gave him a large profit, with which he was able to buy a plot of land. 

Now Diego is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor in order to maintain his coffee plantations. Diego and his group are hoping to get the loan again so they can continue to prosper and improve the quality of life for their families.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su cónyuge en casa de material rústico cuenta con dos hijos en su poder de 5 y 1 año de edad de los cuales el mayor cursa estudios de nivel inicial en el colegio de la zona,en el distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, de la Sierra del Perú. Cliente cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad.

La actividad a la que se dedica es a la cria y venta de cuyes y animales menores, ubicado en el caserío de huancas, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, el préstamo que se le otorgara lo utilizara en comprar de animales menores para su engorde y posterior venta . De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora de sus ingreso y calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 30 years old. He owns a house built with rustic materials, where he lives with his partner and two children aged 5 and 1. The eldest child goes to primary school in Querocotillo, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region of the mountains of Peru. He has very good personal and professional references from local people.

He raises and sells guinea pigs and other small farm animals. He lives in a village called Huancas and has a ten-year experience.

He will use this loan to buy small animals to fatten and sell. This will help him to improve his income and his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy small animals to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio es un hombre casado, una persona que gusta del trabajo independiente, toda su vida fue reconocido como un vendedor de frutas y verduras ambulante que sitúa su coche en una esquina esperando que las personas compren alguno de sus productos que son de diario consumo.

Con su humilde peor necesario trabajo Porfirio logro criar y mantener una familia conformada por su esposa y 4 hijos, a los cuales les brindo educación, un hogar propio, vestimenta entre otras cosas, ahora sus hijos son grandes y profirió sigue trabajando pro el mantenimiento de su hogar por mejorar las condiciones de este, por consolidar un negocio que le sirva de sustento en su vejez y el de su señora esposa, por ello pide tu ayuda, necesita de tu apoyo y solidaridad para apoyar la causa de este hombre del campo que necesita para abastecer su negoció y comprar estanterías para exhibir muchos más productos.

Porfirio solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de frutas y verduras en cantidades considerables debido a que estos se echan a perder rápido, el préstamo le permitirá tener capital para trabajar todo un semestre y algo más y comprar estanterías para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Porfirio is a married man, and a person who enjoys working independently. He is well known locally for selling fruits in the streets. He stands in a street corner with his cart and waits for customers to buy his products every day.

Thanks to his humble but important job, Porfirio was able to raise and sustain his family, which is comprised of his wife and four children. He paid for his children’s education, and gave them a home, clothes and other things they needed. They are now adults and Porfirio continues working to maintain his home in good conditions, and strengthen his business in order to have a source of income when he and his wife become older. This is why he needs your help and support. This countryman needs to stock up his business and buy shelves to display more products.

Porfirio is requesting a loan to buy the right amount of assorted fruits and vegetables, since they go bad quickly. The loan will help him to have working capital for more than six months and to buy shelves to expand his business.

loans.use: to stock up his business and buy shelves to display more products.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
senhora Ana tem 3 filhos, 2 maiores de 18 anos e um com idade escolar, tem 3 netos na sua responsabilidade, vive na casa própria e dedica-se a revenda de carvão vegetal e de produtos da primeira necessidade tendo uma mercearia onde faz os seus trabalhos do seus negocios.
Com o dinheiro do emprestimo vai comprar cerveja, açucar, arroz, refrescos e bolachas.
O seu maior sonho é melhorar as condições de habitação, pagar escola dos seus filhos,expandir o seu negocio e ampliar a sua mercearia.
Os pricipais desafios são financeiros pelo ira trabalhar no sentido de garantir a educação dos seus filhos e custear as despesas familiares na escola.
texts.en:
Ana has three children. Two of them are older than 18 and one goes to school. She has three grandchildren under her care. She lives in a house she owns and earns a living by selling charcoal and essential products. She has a store, and that is where she does business.

With the money from the loan she will buy beer, sugar, rice, beverages and cookies.

Her biggest dream is to make some home improvements, pay for her two sons’ school, expand her business and enlarge her store.

The main challenges she faces are of a financial nature. She will work in order to make sure her two sons can go to school and to cover the home expenses.

loans.use: to buy beer, sugar, rice, beverages and cookies to sell.

loans.name: Ancha

texts.pt:
A  senhora Ancha é solteira mae de uma filha menor de 18 anos de idade mas com idade escolar,tem duas pessoas na sua responsabilidade,vive na casa propria juntos com a sua filha,vive atraves de negocios, para alem de negocio faz tambem trabalhos de ornamentação. 
Com o dinheiro do emprestimo vai comprar cerveja, refrescos, arroz, açucar, e outros produtos da primeira necessidade.
O seu sonho é terminar a sua casa,pagar escola para a sua filha , construir uma mercearia e ampliar o seu negocio.
Tem como desafio terminar a sua casa ,pagar escola para sua filha,gerir melhor o seu negocio para o bem estar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Ancha is single and the mother of a daughter who is not yet 18 and goes to school. She maintains two people. She owns a house where she lives with her daughter. She is a businesswoman, but she also does decoration works.

With the money from the loan she will buy beer, beverages, rice, sugar and other essential products.

Her dreams are to finish building her house, pay for her daughter’s school, build a store and expand her business.

She faces the challenges of finishing building her house, paying her daughter’s school, and being able to better administer her business for her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy beer, beverages, rice, sugar, and other essential products.

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es:
José (foto), se encuentra montado en lo que será quizás su mejor inversión para mejorar y aumentar las ventas en su negocio de venta de carne de cerdo y de pollo la cual transporta y lleva hasta la puerta de su cliente.

José es un hombre de 58 años de edad nacido en las zonas rurales de Antioquia en donde se ha ingeniado para tener un negocio rentable que significara el sustento de su hogar conformado por él y su pareja.

José se encuentra solicitando tu apoyo, un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de la motocicleta que se encuentra montando y que le será de mucha ayuda para transportarse de vereda en vereda, minimizando los cotos de transporte y también le ayudara a entregar un mayor número de pedidos diarios.

Apoya a José que decidió montar su negocio y ser comerciante el sueña con comprar una vivienda y que esta motocicleta sea la primera de una soñada flota de transportadores de alimentos que piensa crear.
texts.en:
Jose(pictured here), is riding what could perhaps be his best investment yet, to improve and increase sales in his business of selling pork and chicken which he delivers to his customer's door step.

Jose is a 58 year old man, born in the rural areas of Antioquia where he has managed to have a profitable business that provides the livelihood of his home made up of himself and his partner.

José is requesting your support, and a loan for him to invest in the purchase of a motorcycle, which he is riding..  This will be very helpful for him so that he can move from village to village, minimizing transport costs and also helping him to deliver a wider number of daily orders.

Support Jose who has decided to set up shop and be a merchant.  His dream is to buy a home and that this motorcycle be the first of a fleet of  food transporters that he plans to create.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to distribute his products.

loans.name: Luis Santiago

texts.es:
Luis Santiago es un hombre de 51 años de edad, es un hombre casado el cual tiene un negocio de taller de mecánica y cuenta con 15 años de experiencia, su labor le ha permitido darle un mejor futuro a su familia y espera seguir ejerciendo su actividad por mucho tiempo más y poder dejar el legado que ha construido a su hijo.

Luis con su negocio ha conseguido un hogar humilde pero propio, su meta es organizarlo poner cerámica, enchapar baño, comprar nuevos electrodomésticos y poco a poco va adquiriendo los implementos para su hogar.

En el momento Luis quiere solicitar un préstamo la razón es que desea comprar un equipo que es un compresor que usa para inflar llantas o pintar vehículos, el que tenía presenta un daño irreparable y necesita comprar uno nuevo ya que es herramienta de vital importancia en su día a día.
texts.en:
Luis Santiago is a 51-year-old man. He is a married man who has a auto repair shop and has more than 15 years of experiences. His work has allowed him to give his family a better future and he hopes to continue carrying out his work for a long time and be able to leave his son a legacy that he has built.

Luis, with his business, has gotten a home that is humble but his own. His goal is to organize it to install ceramic flooring, tile the bathroom, and purchase appliances and little by little he is acquiring the things for his home.

At the moment, Luis wants to ask for a loan because he wants to purchase equipment, a compressor, which he uses to inflate tires or paint vehicles. The one he has is irreparably damaged and he needs to purchase a new one since it is a tool of vital importance in his day to day work.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor to paint cars and inflate tires.

loans.name: Alindor Hipólito

texts.es:
Alindor Hipólito tiene 55 años de edad, soltero, cliente vive en casa propia de material rústico,por un lapso de más de 40 años, natural de la zona, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y económicas.Él vive en la parte rural del Distrito de Pucará, un pueblo de clima caluroso, tranquilo, en su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería mayormente, esta comunidad está ubicada en la Provincia de de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.Contando con servicios de agua y luz.

Él brinda servicios como zapatero, realizando esta actividad desde hace 10 años, ha solicitado el préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de materiales, cuero, pegamentos,tinte, entre otros y de esta manera generar ingresos para obtener mayores ganancias y asi una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alindor Hipolito is 55 years old, single, and lives in his own home, made of rustic materials, for about 40 years.  He is native of this area, and has good personal and professional references.  

He lives in the rural part of Pucara district, a town with a warm climate that is quiet and whose population works in agriculture, trade and mostly animal husbandry. This community is located in Jaen province, which is part of Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. They have water and electrical services.  

He offers services as a shoemaker, and has done this activity for the past 10 years. 

He is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa to purchase materials such as leather, glue, dyes among others, and in this way generate income to obtain increased profits and, in turn, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as glue, dyes, among others.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José es un sorprendente padre de familia, una persona que realizar grandes esfuerzos por ver a su familia sonreír y pasarla bien, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras la cual vende ambulantemente en las calles arrastrando su carreta un gran esfuerzo físico que tiene como recompensa el sustento para su amada familia conformada por él, su esposa y su hijo de 17 años de edad.

Pagar la educación de sus hijos es su objetivo pro ello cada días sale con mucha motivación y no regresa a la casa hasta vender hasta el último artículo de su carreta.

José esta en busca de un préstamo para tener capital de trabajo para ir abasteciendo su carreta con frutas y vegetales gradualmente pues sabe que estos productos deben venderse siempre frescos, una parte del capital será destinado al arreglo de su carreta para que pueda movilizarla con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
José is a surprising father, a person who makes big efforts to see his family smile and have a good time. He works selling fruits and vegetables which he sells as a vendor in the streets, pulling his cart with a great physical effort that has as its compensation the sustenance for his beloved family which is made up of him, his wife and his 17-year-old son.

To pay for his children's education is the objective for which he goes out every day with a lot of motivation and doesn't come back home until he has sold the last item from his cart.

José is looking for a loan to have working capital to stock his cart with fruits and vegetables gradually since he knows that these products should always be sold fresh. A part of the capital will be used to fix his cart so that he can move it more easily.

loans.use: working capital to stock his business gradually and repair his cart.

loans.name: Eddy Santiago

texts.es:
Comprar vivienda es el objetivo que se propuso el joven Eddy, una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que quiere dar cuerpo y alma por seguir su sueño y poder darle esa vivienda a su madre.

Eddy se dedica a la venta de productos para el consumo humano que aportan nutrientes y vitaminas para que el cuerpo se auto regenere naturalmente, inicio con estos productos buscando cambiar el pésimo habito alimenticio que hay en su barrio y poco a poco ha hecho eco con sus productos.

Ahora Eddy no solo quiere seguir distribuyendo estos productos, quiere aprovechar los contactos que tiene para iniciar la venta de ropa juvenil para hombre y dama una nueva línea de venta que espera que le traiga muy buenos resultados y de su grano de arena para la consecución de su sueño de  comprar una vivienda.
texts.en:
To purchase a house is the goal that Eddy has set for himself. He is an enterprising and hard-working person who wants to give his body and soul to follow his dream and be able to give this house to his mother.

Eddy works selling products for human consumption which have nutrients and vitamins so that the body regenerates itself naturally. He began with these products seeking to change the terrible nutrition habits that are in his neighborhood and, little by little, he has spread the news.

Now, Eddy doesn't want to continue selling only these products. He wants to take advantage of the contacts he has to begin to sell children's clothing for boys and girls, a new line of sales that he hopes will bring very good results and be his grain of sand for achieving his dream of purchasing a house.

loans.use: to begin a new line of sales; he will sell children's clothing for girls and boys.

loans.name: Martha Nelly

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 38 años de edad, felizmente casada y madre de 4 hijos (3 hombres de 18, 17, 13 y una mujer de 15 años de edad), tiene una chaza de venta de alimentos, ofrece mangos y frituras, (pasa bocas), un negocio que inicio ante la falta de oportunidades para emplearse, ella tenía que trabajar dado que su familia es numerosa y su esposo recibe un salario mínimo vigente y no cubría todos los gastos mensuales en su hogar.

Desde que Martha tiene el negocio las cosas han mejorado, tienen un mejor día a día ella se siente útil, sus hijos estudian y quiere seguir ese conducto regular y tratar de mejorarlo, por el momento Martha piensa en tener otro puesto de venta y contrastar una persona que lo administre, pero para ello debe producir mayores ventas que den sustento a un salario en caso de que los primeros días generen perdida pro adaptación.

Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido (mango y frituras) y mejoras de carro como unas llantas más grandes para mejorar y facilitar es desplazamiento y comprar una barra más grande done pueda exhibir mayor numero de productos.
texts.en:
Martha is a 38 year old woman. She is happily married and the mother of 4 children (3 boys who are 18, 17 and 13 years old and a girl who is 15 years old). She has a food stall and offers mangos and snacks. She started this business from the lack of opportunities for employment. She needed to work given that her family is large and her husband gets a minimal salary that doesn't cover all of the monthly household expenses. Since Martha has had the business, things have improved. They get better day-by-day and she feels useful. Her children are in school and she wants to continue that workflow and try to improve it. 
For now, Martha is thinking about having another trading post and finding someone to manage it, but to do that she needs to produce larger sales that give sustenance to a salary in case the beginning days generate a loss from adaptation. Martha is asking for a loan to buy supplies (mango and snacks) and car improvements such as bigger tires to improve and facilitate moving. Also, to buy a larger bar where she could showcase a bigger number of products.

loans.use: to buy supplies (mango and snacks) and car improvements such as bigger tires to improve and facilitate moving.

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es:
Salvador es un hombre de 52 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de mercancía (Ropa), tiene su almacén desde el año 2001, un amplio recorrido que le ha ayudado a tener clientes y demostrar que la mejor decisión de su vida fue volverse emprendedor para buscar un mejor camino para su familia.

Hoy salvador necesita tu apoyo, la razón es que necesita un préstamo para actualizar todo el surtido de ropa para hombre y mujer, esta decisión es debido a la fuerte competencia que hay en el sector, por ello con el préstamo quiere captar la atención del público adolescente.

Este préstamo ayudara a Salvador a tener mercancía suficiente para afrontar las fechas especiales que se avecinan como lo son el día del padre, la feria de flores y vacaciones estudiantiles, generando muy buen dinero para el sostenimiento de su familia conformada pro su esposa, sus 5 hijos y su persona.
texts.en:
Salvador is a 52-year-old man who works selling merchandise (clothing). He has had his shop since the year 2001, a long journey which has helped him have customers and show that the best decision in his life was to become an entrepreneur to seek a better path for his family. 

Today, Salvador needs your support. The reason for this is that he needs a loan to update all the stock of men's and women's clothing. This decision is due to the strong competition in the sector, so with the loan he wants to attract the attention of the adolescent public. 

This loan will help Salvador to have sufficient merchandise to face the special dates which are coming up such as Father's Day, the festival of flowers and school vacations, generating very good money to support his family made up of his wife, their five children, and himself.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Maria Gertrudis

texts.es:
Trabajar por su familia siempre ha sido la consigna de esta humilde mujer de 61 años de edad llamada María una mujer separa que lucha por una mejor situación económica y condiciones dignas de vivienda, su arma su tienda de abarrotes la cual le ha servido para mantener su hogar.

Ahora María necesita de tu apoyo ella busca la manera de poder surtir su negocio ya que de momento no tiene capital para hacerlo por ello recurre a la ayuda del crédito el cual será invertido en compra de abarrotes y bebidas principalmente.

María mantiene un hogar en el cual habitan ella y sus tres hijas.
texts.en:
To work for her family has always been the slogan of this humble woman, 61 years old, named María. She is a separated woman who struggles for a better economic situation and respectable housing conditions. Her weapon is her grocery store which has served to support her household. 

Now María needs your support. She is looking for a way to be able to stock her business since at the moment she doesn't have the capital to do it. So, she is turning to the help of the loan which will be invested primarily in the purchase of groceries and drinks.

María supports her home in which she and her three daughters live.

loans.use: to purchase primarily groceries and drinks to stock her business.

loans.name: Demson

texts.en: Demson has more than a decade of running his business. He finds pleasure in doing farming activities, focusing on rice farming. At the age of 49 with 4 children to sustain their needs and provide a good education, he doubles his effort to take care his farming activities. He owes to Paglaum all his capital needs. Recently, he availed another loan to pay for land preparation and purchase fertilizers. In the future, Demson hopes to open a store selling his own produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of Php 15,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record.

loans.use: for house renovation

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a businesswoman, who earns through retailing various items. Her husband is a fisherman, and he manages a small piggery. Evangeline is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Evangeline wants to concrete her house to live comfortably with her family. Recently, she applied for a loan. This loan is intended to purchase bags of cement and additional roof sheets. She is on her way to completing her house.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and additional roof sheets

loans.name: Abisai

texts.en:
Originally from Cuba, Abisai worked hard to save up money. In 2001, he started a small workshop that manufactures furniture. He builds furniture like couches, entertainment centers, and other home furniture when requested. He supports both himself and his wife through his business and loves the freedom and flexibility of his work. 

Making furniture is a true passion of his, and he hopes to use this loan to purchase more materials. He is looking to expand his client base and is proud that his quality and good prices undercut the competition.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his furniture business.

loans.name: Dixie

texts.en:
Dixie is 38 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dixie has a farming vegetables business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Dixie requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

In the future, Dixie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rodrigo Alberto

texts.es:
Rodrigo es un hombre de 35 años de edad que trabaja en su  negocio propio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, es separado de su esposa con la cual tuvo 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad, como buen caballero les cedió la casa para que tuvieran un techo en donde llegar y ayuda para el sostenimiento de sus hijos.


Rodrigo es muy fiel y servicial, trabaja diariamente entre 10 y 12 horas buscando que vender para pensar en una casa para él, pero antes de esto tiene un deber con su negocio, hacerlo crecer, sostenerlo en el tiempo y buscar la manera de hacerlo necesario para las personas del barrio que ese recado que manda una madre de familia a su hijo a comprar algún insumo lo tenga que hacer a su tienda eso es lo que busca Rodrigo por ello quiere destacarse como una tienda modelo en donde puedas encontrar gran surtido de la canasta familiar todo en mismo sitio.

Rodrigo quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos enfocándose principalmente en confitería, licores y cerveza.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a 35-year-old man who works in his own business selling products for the family pantry. He is separated from his wife with whom he had two children, ages 11 and 9. Like a good gentleman, he left them the house so that they would have a roof over their heads and helps to support his children.

Rodrigo is very loyal and helpful, he works every day between 10 and 12 hours, seeking sales to think of a house for himself. But, before this, he has a duty with his business, to make it grow, to sustain it over time, and to seek the way to make it necessary for the people in the neighborhood that when a mother sends her child on an errand to purchase some supplies, they would have to do it in his store. This is what Rodrigo seeks, so he wants to stand out as a model store where you can find a wide assortment for the family pantry, all in the same place. 

Rodrigo wants to ask for a loan to purchase an assortment of products, focusing primarily on sweets, liquor, and beer.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of products, focusing primarily on sweets, liquor, and beer.

loans.name: Honey Lee

texts.en:
Honey Lee is 24 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Honey Lee has a direct selling Fuller Life products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Honey Lee requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products from Fuller Life to sell to her customers.

In the future, Honey Lee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Fuller Life to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jennifer Daniela

texts.es:
Jennifer es una hermosa joven de 20 años de edad que se dedica a estudiar y a la venta de mercancía para poder pagar sus estudios pues proviene de una familia humilde y ella misma se busca la forma para comprar sus cosas y pagar su matrícula y cuando puede ayuda en su hogar llevando un mercado de alimentos o dinero.

Jennifer como está empezando hace poco su profesión necesita de un apoyo económico para abastecerse de surtido de ropa, pijamas, lociones y accesorios, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar estos productos.

Apoya a esta hermosa joven que hace su mayor esfuerzo para estudiar y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jennifer is a lovely young woman, 20 years old, who goes to school and works selling merchandise to pay for her education, since she comes from a humble family. She is looking for the way to purchase her things and pay her tuition and, when she can, she helps in her home by bringing some food or money. 

Jennifer, as she is just beginning her profession, needs economic support so stock up on an assortment of clothing, pajamas, lotions and accessories, so she asks for a loan to purchase these products. 

Support this lovely young woman who gives her best effort to go to school and support her family.

loans.use: to stock up with an assortment of clothing, pajamas, lotions, and accessories.

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, debido a la pobreza y a la poca importancia que tenia sus padres no continuo, es madre soltera porque su pareja murió hace 21 años y ya no quiso casarse de nuevo, tuvo 2 hijos pero ya no están con ella, solo viven 2 nietos en su casa.

Alicia, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 14 años, este oficio lo aprendió con su papá pues él siempre le decía que era mejor aprender a trabajar que estudiar; actualmente es líder de un grupo de mujeres que trabajan sembrando hortalizas, ya que una organización les dio una casa maya donde tienen sembrado chile, tomate y pepino, ella comienza su día a las 5:00 a.m. para preparar a sus nietos para ir a la escuela, luego se traslada para su trabajo que está a 3 kilómetros.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar semilla, abono, pesticidas y para preparar la tierra.

Alicia, sueña con poder tener un puesto en el mercado, para vender su producto y ampliar la siembra de hortalizas.
texts.en:
Alicia is 57 years old. She went to school until the second grade but due to poverty and the little importance that her parents had, she did not continue. She is a single mother because her husband died 21 years ago and she did not want to marry again. She had 2 children but they no longer live with her. 2 grandchildren live with her. 
Alicia has made a living in agriculture for 14 years. She learned this job from her dad because he always told her that it was more important to learn how to work rather than study. Now she is the leader of a group of women that work planting vegetables. An organization gave them a Mayan house where they have planted pepper, tomato, and cucumber. She begins her day at 5:00 A.M. to get her grandchildren ready for school. Later she goes to work which is 3 kilometers away. 
The loan that she is asking for is to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and to prepare the land. Alicia dreams of being able to have a market stall to sell her products and increase the vegetable planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to replace the latrine.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa es una señora trabajadora, dedicada que día con día trabaja para darle a su familia lo mejor, Santa se encuentra  muy satisfecha con el crédito anterior pues gracias a ello logro comprar sus insumos para el cultivo de almacigo y afortunadamente esto se vendió a un buen precio, por lo que obtuvo mejores ganancias y la calidad de vida de su familia ha cambiado, ella ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar cuatro cuerdas de terreno con cultivo de café y banano, pues ella considera que esta es una buena oportunidad para poder incrementar su cultivo y su patrimonio.
 Santa tiene las esperanzas de contar nuevamente con su apoyo para poder realizar la compra. Ella sueña con construir una casa  nueva para su familia donde tengan más comodidad.
texts.en:
Santa is a hard-working woman, who works day to day to give her family the best. Santa is very satisfied with the previous loan because, thanks to that, she managed to purchase her supplies to grow seedlings and luckily she sold them at a very good price, so that she got more earnings and her family's quality of life has changed. Now, she asks for another loan to purchase four plots of land with coffee and banana cultivation, since she thinks that this is a good opportunity to increase her crops and her assets. 

Santa has hopes of having your support again to be able to make the purchase. She dreams of building a new house for her family so that they are more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase four plots of land with coffee and banana cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an industrial stove and raw materials such as rice, meat, vegetables, and oil to respond to the demand for food.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, 45, is a married woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Edna has a direct selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Edna requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products like body soap, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell to her customers.

Edna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products like body soap, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 48 years old and has two children.

Her husband works as a liaison officer with minimum salary and is barely able to provide for their daily needs, much less the education of her children. 

Josie is determined to give her children a future education, so she opened a sari-sari store (small grocery store) from the 5,000 PHP she saved from her husband's salary. She bought biscuits, noodles, candies, eggs and other items and sell in front of her house, using a makeshift table. 

Eventually her store was patronized by her neighbors. 

Josie has been a SEED partner for two years and through the loan and hard work, Josie was able to renovate the front of her house to build a store stall and add a screen. She also added mineral water, salted fish and electronic loads.

Josie still wants to expand her store and add more items to complete the most needed commodities demanded by her customers.

Josie is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy 10 boxes of shampoo, 10 boxes of snack foods, five boxes of canned goods, five boxes of bottle goods (ketchup, soy sauce, cooking oil) and other items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Josie is very hopeful to increase her sales to help her with their family's expenses and save up for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, snack foods, canned goods and bottle goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: Federico de 60 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de artículos varios y es gracias a ello que ha logrado llevar el sustento a su familia. Federico habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos un varón de 19 años y una hija de 22 años de edad. Federico desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este en el invierno anterior presento filtraciones que causaron problemas de salud a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Federico, 60 years old, is a hard-working man who has worked for the past 15 years selling various things and it is thanks to this that he has managed to bring sustenance to his family. Federico lives in his own house with his wife and their two children, a 19-year-old boy and a 22-year-old daughter. Federico wants to replace the roof on his house, since last winter there were leaks which caused health problems for his family, so he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to replace the roof on his house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to replace the roof on his house as soon as possible.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Ross Meri

texts.es:
Ross Meri tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su menor hija en una casa alquilada, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de venta de comida en un local céntrico del distrito de Cayalti.El presente crédito será utlizado como capital de trabajo para la compra de mesas y sillas, entre otra cosas, con lo cual busca poder ampliar su negocio. Con lo cual podrá ampliar su negocio y poder otorgar una mejor atención y asi poder aumentar sus ventas, por ende aumentar sus ingresos y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ross Meri is 39 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her youngest daughter in a rented house, in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The population in this district works in agriculture and trade. 

She works in the business of selling food in a central location in Cayaltí district. The current loan will be used as working capital to purchase tables and chairs, and other things, with which she seeks to be able to expand her business. With this, she will be able to expand her business and be able to offer better service and, so, be able to increase her sales, with the end of increasing her income and in this way improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs, and other things, to expand her business.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 53 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Theresa has a food production business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Ma. Theresa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. 

In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Wendelina

texts.en:
Wendelina works hard to support her family. Wendelina is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

Wendelina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Wendelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Safiyanu

texts.en:
Safiyanu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tafida Village. Safiyanu  joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Safiyanu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will help him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Safiyanu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials and finish building the bathroom that she has begun, so that she will get better sanitary conditions.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a woman with four dependents. Her oldest child is 18 and the youngest is 5. Together with her family, she lives in Antequera, Bohol. Her husband is a driver. 

She operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities like canned goods, noodles, sugar, beverages and toiletries. 
She needs additional capital to finance her small store.

She has requested a loan to purchase supplies like groceries, feeds and gasoline. These are essentials in maintaining the stocks of her store. This will enable her to augment her income and settle her finances.

Elenita would like to handle her sari-sari store business properly to improve the family's status of living and also to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like groceries, feeds and gasoline.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joan is 28 years old and has three children who are in school.

Joan has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of footwear, toys, clothing and school uniforms.

Joan has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Joan would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of footwear, toys, clothing and school uniforms.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Helen has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 59 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Carina works very hard to provide for them.

Carina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Carina has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Carina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 56 years old, a widow with five children.

Minda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Minda requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Minda has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Minda would like to save enough money to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from boarding house rental and fattening pigs businesses. Amalia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 65 years old and widowed with five children. Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Corazon has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, sanitary pads, noodles, bread, candies, etc. 

Corazon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia is widowed and works hard to support her family. Leocadia has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines.

Leocadia requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell to her customers.

Leocadia has been in this business for 10 years now.

Leocadia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Aileen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Aileen has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Aileen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sherlinda

texts.en:
Sherlinda works hard to support her family. Sherlinda is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years now.

Sherlinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Sherlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 60 years old and married. She has three children.  

Cecilia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Cecilia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dylen

texts.en:
Dylen is 41 years old and runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, bath soap, cooking oil, vinegar, detergent soap, etc. 

Dylen requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, bath soap, cooking oil, vinegar, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

In the future, Dylen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, bath soap, cooking oil, vinegar, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Aurora Elena

texts.es:
Margarita es una empresaria del área rural de 40 años de edad, madre de tres hijos de 13, 8, 4 años de edad que dependen económicamente de ella.

En el año 2000 inicio un negocio de cultivo de maíz dando una solución a muchos productores agropecuarios avícolas que para comprar el maíz de sus aves debían realizar un largo desplazamiento. Una movida muy inteligente que ha significado tener el pan de cada día en la mesa de su hogar.

Desde que inicio su negocio lo hizo con dos propósitos y uno de ellos lo está cumpliendo que es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y otro que tiene pendiente pero que sigue tras el, comprar una vivienda propia, un lugar suyo donde pueda cultivar un largo territorio de maíz, se sueña con ser la productora numero uno de la plaza de mercado y abastecer a todos los avicultores de la zona.

Margarita quiere solicitar un préstamo para cultivar mayor terreno de maíz, tendrá que hacer canales de cultivo por lo que necesita mano de obra masculina para esta difícil labor, comprar fertilizantes, riegos y pesticidas.
texts.en: Margarita is a 40 year old business woman in a rural area. She is the mother of three sons, who are 13, 8, and 4 years old and who economically depend on her. In the year 2000, she began a business growing corn, giving a solution to many poultry farmers who had to make a long journey to buy corn for their birds. It has been a very intelligent move that has meant putting food on the table in her home. She began her business with two purposes and she is completing one of them which is to improve her family's quality of life. The other one is pending but she's still going after it. It is to buy her own home, a place where she can cultivate a large territory of corn. She dreams of being the number one producer of the marketplace and to supply all of the poultry farmers in the area. Margarita wants to ask for a loan to get more land to cultivate corn. She will need to make channels which she needs male labor to complete the hard work, and she will also buy fertilizers, irrigation and pesticides.

loans.use: to get more land to cultivate corn, to make channels which she needs male labor to complete the hard work, and to buy fertilizers, irrigation and pesticides.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Maimai Village. Ezekiel  joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ezekiel  will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ezekiel  now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Toma

texts.en:
Toma, who is 36 years old, lives in Kutaisi city, west Georgias. He has school-aged son and wife, who lives abroad and takes care of her family from there. Toma's only income comes from his wife's transfers. He has great desire to start his own activity, as the transfers aren't enough to make normal living conditions for his son. Toma was unable to start any stable job, so he decided to be involved in private business and start trading. 

Toma requested a financial support for a business start-up. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Toma applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of a Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting poor people to start or re-start businesses. 

Toma plans to start trading with fruits and vegetables, purchase at wholesale prices and sell at the local open market in increased prices. Toma  will generate his own income and become financially independent. 
He is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to give his son a good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. 

Toma is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase stock of fruits and vegetables and start trading

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maimai Village. Joshua joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Joshua  will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Joshua  now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to all his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Ludeisy

texts.es:
Ludeisy es una joven de 24 años de edad que trabaja vendiendo mercancía de catalogo, empezó su negocio con el afán de generar recursos para pagar sus estudios universitarios y en vista de los buenos resultados quiere meterla todo el entusiasmo y sus ganas para no solo pagar sus estudios si no que también quiere apoyar en su hogar, dar un pequeño capital para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por ello busca mejorar sus ventas, tener más clientes, poder montar en algún momento un local propio de venta de mercancía, ropa, accesorios y lociones, pero para todo ello necesita capital que sustente las acciones que necesita realizar para mejorar, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido en lociones, ropa, pijamas y accesorios para hombre y mujeres.

Tu apoyo será muy significativo para esta empresaria que trata de forzar su propio destino a partir de trabajo humilde y honesto.
texts.en:
Ludeisy is a young woman, 24 years old, who works selling merchandise from catalogs. She began her business with the desire to generate resources to pay for her university education, and with the good results, she wants to jump in with all of her enthusiasm and desire to not only pay for her education but she also wants to support her household, give a little capital to improve her family's quality of life. For this, she seeks to improve her sales, have more customers, and be able to establish her own retail space selling merchandise, clothing, accessories and lotions at some point. But, for all of this, she needs capital to support the actions that she needs to take to improve, so she asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of lotions, clothing, pajamas, and accessories for men and women.

Your support will be very important for this businesswoman who tries to create her own destiny through humble and honest work.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of lotions, clothing, pajamas, and accessories for men and women.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 62 years old, a widowed mother of two children. 

She has been engaged in selling auto accessories in the market for seven years and she is still eager to manage her business. 

Her income is enough to sustain her needs, but she wants to extend help to her grandchildren. To do this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy vehicle spare parts and accessories to sell. She hopes to sell more, and earn bigger for her future and that of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lieza

texts.en:
Ma. Lieza is 44 years old and married with five children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Lieza requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Lieza has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Trinidad is 36 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Trinidad has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and items for her food vending business.

Trinidad has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and items for her food vending business

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and livestock raising businesses. 

Jeanne is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Jeanne has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Alida

texts.en:
Alida is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alida is 50 years old now.

Alida has a food processing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Alida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a favourable place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to have a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Brenda is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Brenda has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Brenda has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more contianers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Wilmer De Jesus

texts.es:
Wilmer es un hombre de 40 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de alimento y jugos naturales, trabaja en las calles de Medellín donde gracias a la experiencia y su formalidad ha logrado idealizar clientes que diariamente desayunan en su puesto de trabajo.

Este negocio le ha servido para el sustento y para ir pagando su casa pro cuotas se siente muy feliz e desarrollar su actividad y quiere que su negocio crezca, que sea capaz de atender y satisfacer un mayor numero de clientes.

Pensando en este deseo que puede cumplir Wilmer solicita un préstamo el cual destinara de la siguiente manera:

•	La mitad del dinero será para la compra de surtido de frutas y productos fritos
•	La otra mitad será para la compra de sillas, mesas, manteles y adecuación de su negocio.
Wilmer quiere mejorar sus ingresos para pagar rápidamente su hogar y pensar en conseguir un local y tener marca propia y algún día convertir este puesto de venta de alimento y jugos en un afamado y buscado restaurante.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a 40-year-old man who sells food and natural juices. He works in the streets of Medellín where, thanks to the experience and his reliability, he has managed to put customers on a pedestal, who have their breakfast daily at his workplace.

This business has served him as sustenance and to pay his home installments. He feels very happy in developing his work and wants his business to grow and be able to meet and satisfy a greater number of customers.

Thinking of this wish that he can fulfill, Wilmer is requesting a loan which he will use as follows: Half of the money will be for the purchase of assorted fruits and fried products; the other half will be for the purchase of chairs, tables, tablecloths, and his business's adequacy.

Wilmer wants to improve his income to quickly pay his home, consider getting a place, have his own brand, and someday turn this food and juices sales stall into a famous and sought after restaurant.

loans.use: to supply his business with fruits (mangoes) and fried products and to make locative improvements.

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en: Yunusa is a Babban Gona farmer from Kunda Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Yunusa no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to move into a better home. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Yunusa has ambitious plans to harvest  180  bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yunusa now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en:
Basiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tafida Village. Basiru joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Basiru suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to provide healthcare for his children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Basiru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Basiru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 children in Khelvachauri district, where they are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow different kinds of trees and sells the harvest seasonally. In addition, they have a cow and Badri's wife produces and sells cheese at a good price at local shops. 

Badri is very motivated to open a restaurant and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2500 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase wood and will make wooden chairs and tables. He will also purchase a stock of food and will open a restaurant in the open air. Badri already has a space near the river, where he is going to open his restaurant. 

He hopes that the business will be profitable and he will work there with his wife to make clients better services.

loans.use: to open an open air restaurant near a river and improve his family's welfare.

loans.name: Nanilyn

texts.en:
Nanilyn works hard to support her family. Nanilyn is married with two children and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Nanilyn requested a PHP 55000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like shorts, shoes, slippers, blouses, t-shirts, pants etc.

Nanilyn has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from buy and sell personal collection.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like shorts, shoes, slippers, blouses, t-shirts, pants etc

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia está profundamente agradecido con usted por el apoyo brindado pues gracias al crédito  ella logro comprar más mercaderías  y surtió mejor su tienda, ella cuenta que  confía mucho en ADICLA porque es una institución que le ha ayudado mucho a superarse, es por eso que ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder  comprar más productos para su tienda como azúcar, frijol, gaseosas.
Hortencia espera contar nuevamente con el préstamo para seguir prosperando y así comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Hortencia's profoundly grateful to you for your support, because thanks to the loan she was able to buy more merchandise and better stock her store.  She said she trusts ADICLA a lot because it's an institution that has helped her improve herself.

For that reason she's now requesting another loan to buy more products for her store, such as sugar, beans, and soda.

Hortencia hopes to have another loan so she can continue to prosper and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, beans, and soda

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Yungaqui Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE YUNGAQUI II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucia ella es soltero y tiene 69 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de verduras.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Inmaculada Concepción de Yungaqui II Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Lucia, is 69 years old and single, and has one child.  She works in her business raising animals--guinea pigs and chickens.  Through this work she wants to start a grocery store, because her dream is to have her own business.  She also wants to have a bigger space for selling her animals.

Lucia's requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens as well as animal feed.

The other members work in grain sales, animal sales, a grocery store, and vegetable sales.

Lucia's grateful to those who are part of her dream with this loan, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens as well as animal feed

loans.name: Agendampora Group

texts.en:
Evalyne is a hardworking woman with 8 children aged between 12-30 years and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She deals in farming alongside market vending to make ends meet. Her main challenge is unpredictable weather changes which affected her expected returns. 

She is requesting a loan to buy pesticides,fertilizers and pay for labor to weed her farm.
She is a member of Agendampora Group where members guarantee each other to repay a loan.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers and pay for labor to weed her farm.

loans.name: Bichiko

texts.en:
Bichiko is 64 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and student daughter in Lanchkhuti district. Bichiko is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns a plot of agricultural land, where he grows maize and nut trees. In addition, he has 3 cows and 6 calves and his wife produces dairy products to sell. The main source of income for their family is from these activities.
