Her desire for self-improvement inspired her to form a bank of people to request a loan and improve their businesses, which include food sales, sweater sales, construction supplies, baby clothing, fried potato sales, athletic clothing sales, and a neighborhood store.

Her business is selling hardware such as screws, wire, hammers, saws, and other items.  She works Monday through Friday during the day in her permanent outdoor sales space.  "Hardware is in some ways a man's world and it's hard for a woman to make her way," she said.  The advantage of her business is that she has regular sales.  The disadvantage is the lack of hardware supplies.  Her dream is to run a stable business.

Guedy wants to supply her hardware store with all types of materials to improve her selection and establish her business, so she's requesting a loan.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the two years she has been in this line of work.

loans.use: to stock her hardware store with high-turnover merchandise to establish her store

loans.name: Esmeraldas Group

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional. 
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un lugar que reúne una vez al año cerca a mil artesanos en la denominada feria de ‘la Alasita’ dónde se oferta todo tipo de bienes en miniatura con el fin de que esa miniatura se materialice y se haga realidad. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Olga es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo sujetado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro, viste blusa blanca manga corta y pantalón azul). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de sus familiares que trabajan, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de polleras, venta de chamarras para niños, taller de soldadura, tapizado de autos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares y venta de material escolar, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno de papa), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), y otros. Actividad que realiza en las afueras de su domicilio, bajo un par de sombrillas se acomodan las mesas y sillas que rellenan el espacio al aire libre de su puesto de comida, el clima es cálido y los clientes solicitan hielo y bebidas frías, las cuales no existen porque no cuenta con refrigerador, “mi negocio crece constantemente y los clientes van aumentando en número y no tengo muebles donde atenderlos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes diarios y continuos, la desventaja es la falta de mobiliario y utensilios de cocina para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas, sillas e utensilios de cocina para atender a sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Olga solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas e utensilios de cocina para atender a sus clientes y con los beneficios mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is a 27 year-old woman who is single and has no children. She has a business selling traditional food.  She is enterprising, independent, optimistic, responsible, and very hardworking.  Her business is located in the southern part of the city, a place where once a year about 1,000 artisans meet in a  craft fair called "La Alasita," where they offer all types of miniature items for sale.  People buy these miniatures in the hope of obtaining the actual item in the future.  This area has a hot sub-tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius. 

Olga has a dark complexion, dark eyes, long black hard pulled back behind her neck, and a slim physique.  Her native language is Guarani, which she speaks with her family.  She also speaks Spanish in the local culture and in her business.  In the photo she is seen in the center, wearing a short-sleeved white shirt and blue pants. Olga lives with relatives who also work.  They live in their own home built of wood.  The house has a tin roof and earthen floor, and has potable water, electricity and a sewage system.  

Olga's desire to excel led her to form a communal bank with people who have a variety of businesses, including: selling traditional skirts, selling children's jackets, a welding workshop, auto upholstery, selling juice smoothies, selling cell phone covers, and selling school supplies.  They got together to request a loan to improve their businesses.  Olga has a business selling traditional dishes such as: bone soup, stuffed chicken neck, rice with milk and cheese, and other dishes.  She carries out her business in the areas surrounding her home under a pair of umbrellas that shade the tables and chairs that fill the space outside of her concession stand.  The climate is hot, and the customers request ice and cold drinks that they lack because they don't have a refrigerator.  "My business constantly grows and the customers grow in number, and I don't have the furniture to serve them," she comments.  

The advantage of Olga's business is that she has daily and regular customers.  The disadvantage is that she lacks the furniture and kitchen utensils to  serve her customers.  This is the first loan cycle that she has participated in during the 8 years that she has been developing this business. This is why Olga is requesting a loan to buy tables, chairs, and cooking utensils to serve her customers and improve the profitability of her business.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 18 y 25 años y una hija mujer de 22 años, y su negocio es la conexión de gas domiciliario.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, dedicada, independiente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Pampahasi’ ubicado al norte de la ciudad, al pie de las faldas del cerro donde las calles son pendientes y empinadas. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Angela es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello castaño largo hasta la altura de los hombros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su esposo que trabaja en el mismo negocio y con sus 3 hijos que son independientes, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la conexión de gas domiciliario; los clientes se contactan con ella para que se encargue de presupuestar la obra (materiales, mano de obra, etc.) y gestionar todos los trámites necesarios (técnicos y administrativos) hasta la conexión del suministro, sin necesidad que concurra el cliente a las oficinas de la Empresa, “inicié mi negocio fruto de la nacionalización de los hidrocarburos, eso creó la demanda y actualmente administro un negocio familiar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la demanda es constante, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de material de  trabajo como; tuberías, sierras metálicas, pegamento y otros. Su sueño es consolidarse en el mercado, ella desea abastecer su inventario con la compra de tuberías para la conexión de gas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Angela solicita un préstamo para la compra de tuberías para su negocio de conexión de gas domiciliario.
texts.en:
Angela is a 46 year old married mother of two sons aged 18 and 25 and a 22 year old daughter. Her business is connecting gas in homes. She is a good mother, enterprising, dedicated, independent, responsible and hard-working.

Her business takes place in the Pampahasi area. It is located to the north of the city at the foot of the mountains where the streets are steep and hard to climb. It has a cold and dry climate with daily temperatures that vary between 0 and 12 degrees Celsius. Angela is wheat colored, has dark colored eyes and uses glasses. She has dark brown hair down to her shoulders, is short in stature and robust in build. Her native language is Aymara which she speaks in her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business.

She lives her life with her husband who works in the same business and her 3 children who are independent. They live in a room that is property of the family built of brick and cement with a metal roof and wood floor that has running water, electricity, gas and sewage. Her business is connecting gas to homes. Her clients contact her to take charge of budgeting the work (materials, labor, etc.) and fulfill all the required processes (technical and administrative) through to the actual gas connection, without the client having to go to the company's offices. "I started my business because of the nationalization of hydrocarbons. This created the demand and I actually run a family business", she comments. The advantage of the business is that it is constant. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy working material like pipes, metal saws, glue and others. Her dream is to consolidate her market.

She wants to stock up on her inventory buying pipes for the gas connections. This is her first loan with the institution in the four years she has had this business. For these reasons Angela is requesting a loan to buy pipes for her business connecting gas to homes.

loans.use: to buy pipes for her business of connecting gas in homes.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 56-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in Gori district. Nodar wants to start a fruit and vegetable trading business so he requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan and start trading business. 

With the received credit Nodar will purchase fruit and vegetables and will start a trading business, in order to increase the family income and with increased income improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to begin to trade fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Andres Everto

texts.es:
Él es Andres es un hombre de 40 años de edad que se dedica a asistir un salón de belleza en la ciudad de Medellín, un trabajo que le hace expresar su libre personalidad y en el que se refugia de algunas burlas que recibe de personas que no comprenden el camino que tomo.

Andres es muy respetuoso, honrado y trabajar que está haciendo su mejor esfuerzo por hacer crecer su negocio para cumplir un deseo que se trazo un día cualquiera de 1995 cuando inicio su empresa el cual es comprar su vivienda propia.

Andres quiere solicitar un préstamo para darle un cambio de imagen a su local, el dinero será destinado a remodelaciones locativas, compra de activos como tv led, un buen equipo de sonido, pintura e insumos para surtir su vitrina donde vende los productos que usa en sus pacientes.
texts.en:
Andres is a 40 year old man who works taking care of a beauty salon in the city of Medellín. It is work that allows him to express his personality freely and where he can avoid some of the mocking he receives from people who do not understand the path he has taken.

Andres is very respectful, honest and he works with his best effort to create his business to fulfill a wish that he planned one day in 1995 when he started his business. Which is to buy his own house.

Andres wants to request a loan to change the image of his shop. The money will be destined to renovate his shop, buy fixed assets like a LED television, good sound equipment, paint and supplies to stock his display case where he sells products for his clients use.

loans.use: to renovate his shop, buy fixed assets like a LED television, good sound equipment, paint and supplies to stock his display case where he sells products for his clients use.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 48 year old hardworking single lady with 10 children living in Masindi, Uganda. She deals in cattle fattening alongside milk selling. She started her business in 1994 with the intention of catering for her family needs being a single parent. However her biggest challenge is inadequate capital to sustain her business but she hopes to expand her business so as to get income to educate her children. 

She is requesting for a loan to buy more cows for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening to sell,

loans.name: Adi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Adi, one of Ruma agents. Adi lives in Lumajang, located approximately 150 km southeast of Surabaya, the capital city of East Java, Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his son. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive coming to his stall and he decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand his business in technology. 

Right now, Adi is becoming a mobile airtime credits for his community. He feels happy because since he is becoming a Ruma's agent, he can give social impact to his community that needs access to such services. His community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, he needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Adi’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on his community can have access to better products with lower pricrd

Adi is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping village community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy petrol, diesel, kerosene oil and LPG for her husband's fuel station.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rita, one of Ruma’s agents. Rita is a lady who lives in Lumajang, a regency located in East Java province, Indonesia, about 20 hours by train from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Rita lives there with her husband and her only cute son. She sells mobile airtime credits to her community. Rita joined Ruma almost a year ago and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to her house. She decided to join Ruma because she was interested in Ruma's system and wants to try to become an entrepreneur, as well as give more contribution to her comnmunity. Rita is a kind and cheerful person. Her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile airtime provider. 

As the business grows, Rita needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Rita's goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce service for her community, so her community can have access to better products with lower prices. Rita is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping village community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Jose Napoleon

texts.es: José de 21 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que vive actualmente en la vivienda de sus padres, por lo que se siente feliz de apoyarlos en su vejez.  José se gana la vida prestando sus servicios en una barbería, en la que día a día pone su mayor esfuerzo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos económicos. José  ha decidido comenzar una nueva etapa en su vida, por lo que ha decidido casarse y formar  una familia,   pero él desea brindar a su futura esposa un lugar propio donde vivir, por lo que ha decidido construir su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, grava, arena, ladrillo, hierro y lámina para construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, 21 years old, is a working man currently living in his parent's home, who he happily supports in their old age. José makes a living by providing his services in a barbershop, where he puts forth his best effort on a daily basis since it's his only source of income. 

José has decided to begin a new stage in his life, so he has decided to get married and start a family. However, he wants to give his future wife a proper place to live, so he decided to build a home. This is the reason why he requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, gravel, sand, brick, iron and sheet metal to build his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, gravel, sand, brick, iron, and sheet metal to build his home.

loans.name: Los Chiles Group

texts.es: Jazmina, es la coordinadora del grupo ¨Los Chiles¨, ella de 31 años, casada y con 3 hijos de edades de 3, 7 y 10 años respectivamente se dedica a su negocio de ventas de cosméticos. Inicio su negocio hace 3 años  con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja como mecánico.  Ella desea el crédito para la compra de perfumes, cremas y bodys. Con esto ella aumentara la venta de productos y ofrecerá más variedad a su clientela.  Las otras integrantes son Rosa, 21 años, quien comercializa ropa usada y Elizabeth, 40 años quien tiene una mini-pulpería. Con el crédito aprobado están seguras seguir aumentando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jazmina is the coordinator of the group "Los Chiles". She is 31 years old and married with 3 children ages 3, 7 and 10. She make a living in her business selling cosmetics. She started her business three years ago with the help of her husband, who works as a mechanic. She wants the loan for the purchase of perfumes, creams and bodysuits. With it, she'll increase the sale of products and provide more variety to her customers.

The other members are Rosa, 21, who sells used clothing and Elizabeth, 40, who has small grocery store. With the approved loan they are sure to further increase their profits.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams and bodysuits.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a second time borrower of the institution appying for 3,500,000/=. She is a married woman aged 47 years and has 4 children that are school going. Sofia is shrewd lady and this can be seen by all the achievements in the last 6 years when dealing in selling of ladies' garments, tailoring and frying popcorn that she distributes to nearby schools. She uses small capital but he has been able to feed and educate her children, purchase a small piece of land and put up a small residential house.  

Sofia has two main challenges now that is,slow working and break down of her popcorn machine.  She thought of applying for another loan that she would use to boost her working capital by purchasing more sewing machines and also being able to replace the broken machine.

Sofia has high hope of seeing her business exist for all her life as well as building more rental which shall help her enhance her income

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and replace her popcorn machine for better profits

loans.name: Herminita

texts.en:
Herminita, age 51, raises pigs to earn her living. She has been engaged in her business for two years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She and her husband have four children, one of whom is still in school.

Herminita requested a loan in the amount of PhP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, she would like to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, age 70, runs a general store business to earn an income. She has been engaged in this work for 10 years and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She and her husband have four children.

Alicia has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 6,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase a variety of grocery items to offer for sale.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ligaya is 46 years old and has one child is still in school.

Ligaya has a buy and sell animals feeds business in the Philippines. Ligaya requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of animals feed to sell to her stall.

Ligaya has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of animals feed to sell at her stall

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a Babban Gona farmer from Sabon garin Kuzuntu Village. Joshua joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Joshua will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Joshua would like to use his extra earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Yankho Group

texts.en:
Janet is 38 years old and a mother of five children. In order to  financially support her family, Janet sells beans, Irish potatoes and tomatoes to people surrounding her community. The profits she makes from her business help her to provide school fees and other basic needs to her children.

Janet is requesting for another loan in order to buy more commodities as this will help her to increase her profits.She hopes to send her children to better schools and plans to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, beans and Irish potatoes to be able to send her children to better schools

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en: Ishaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sabon grain Kuzuntu Village. Ishaya joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ishaya will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Ishaya has set high goals of harvesting 70 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Ishaya has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 56 years old, married, and has one child to provide for. To earn a living she is engaged in a sari-sari store business (variety store). She also helps her husband as a farmer in providing for their family. She wants to increase their family income, so she borrowed a loan to buy more inventory to sell in her store. By increasing her inventory, she can earn more income.

Lolita's plans for the future are to save money and to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs for better production and income.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 51 years old, married, and has six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Edita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like dried fish, snack foods, home care products, and groceries.

Edita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Edita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like dried fish, snack foods, home care products, and groceries

loans.name: Cherry Fe

texts.en:
Cherry Fe is a married woman with six children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cherry Fe is 51 years old.

Cherry Fe has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Cherry Fe has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Gapgaz

texts.en:
Gapgaz is 35 year-old married man, from Kazreti borough. He has a wife and 3 children. The family has small agribusiness, particularly cultivating potatoes. Gapgaz also offers private driving lessons for local people and gets small income from this. 

He wants somehow to increase his family's living condition and start stable activity. Now, he needs financial support to purchase a car and start taxi business. 

Gapgaz has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will greatly assist Gapgaz and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 40 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and the mother of 4 children. Her husband has been running a general store for past 6 years, where he is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Tahira's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore Tahira has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 
Tahira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business inventory

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a Babban Gona farmer from Kunda Vilage. Samaila joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Samaila will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Samaila would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Akilu

texts.en: Akilu  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kunda Village. Akilu joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Akilu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Akilu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Noha

texts.en:
Noha is a 63-year-old married mother of one child and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial situation of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, she started eighteen years ago helping her husband in agriculture, where she rents croplands, plants them (Olives, figs, grapes, etc..), and then sell the crops. Through the years, she also started using olives to make special soaps.

Noha is a hard worker, and ambitious lady, who is trying hard to develop her business. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to rent more croplands which will help her increase her production. 

Noha hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying her family's needs inside the camp.

loans.use: to rent more croplands to help increase her olives production, to make special soaps

loans.name: Señor De Ecce Homo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE ECCE HOMO, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Cirila continua con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo de forma ambulatoria  a todos sus clientes que le solictan, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de casacas, polos  entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de artesanía, compra y venta de llaveros, trabajadores independientes.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the SEÑOR DE ECCE HOMO community bank, located in the department of Cusco.  

Cirila continues with her business selling clothing.  She is a responsible and enterprising person.  She continues selling as a street vendor to everyone who places an order.  This work is how she moves her family forward.

She is requesting this loan to purchase sports jerseys, polo shirts, and other items.

The group members are grateful for the loan provided and promise to make their repayments according to the established schedule.

The other group members work selling crafts, buying and selling keys, and as independent workers.

loans.use: to purchase sports jerseys, polo shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano. 
Ella es emprendedora, paciente, agradable, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona ‘plan 3000’ que se caracteriza por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, ubicado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Adriana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla. Su vida la disfruta en compañía de sus padres que trabajan, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, shorts, polos, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en horas del día 6 días a la semana, visitando diferentes comercios, su forma de negocio es la ropa de temporada, “se acerca la época fría del año y necesito abastecerme de ropa abrigada…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se vende constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder invertir y ampliar su negocio. Su sueño es abrir un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano temporada de invierno por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adriana solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de invierno de segunda mano por mayor para abrir un puesto fijo de venta.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 28 year-old single woman without children and her business is selling secondhand clothing. 

She is enterprising, patient, friendly, kind, responsible and very hardworking. She does her business as a traveling salesperson in the "Plan 3000" zone which is located in the southern part of the city and is known for the multiculturalism of it's inhabitants; Aymarás, Quechuas and Guaraníes, and migrants who appropriated the place and established commerce, which is constantly growing. The climate is warm and subtropical and daytime temperatures vary between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius. 

Adriana has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long black hair that she wears tied back. She is of short stature with a thin physique and her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish because of the mainstream culture and because of the business she is developing. She enjoys her life in the company of her parents, who work. They live in their own room constructed of brick and cement with drinking water, electricity and sewage. 

Her business is selling secondhand clothing such as pants, shorts, t-shirts, blouses, shirts, sweaters and jackets, etc. She works during the day six days a week, visiting different shops. Her business is focused on seasonal clothing. She says "the cold season is approaching and I need to stock up on warm clothing." The advantage of her business is that clothes are constantly sold and the disadvantage is the lack of capital to be able to invest in and expand her business. 

Her dream is to open a permanent sales stall. She wants to invest in her business through the purchase of wholesale secondhand winter clothing. This is her first loan with the institution in the two years that she has been developing her business. It is for these reasons that Adriana is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale secondhand winter clothing to open a permanent sales stall.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale secondhand winter clothing to open a permanent sales stall.

loans.name: Hermelina

texts.en:
Hermelina is 38 years old and married with four children.

Hermelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Hermelina has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buy and sell coconut wine.

Hermelina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Madlena

texts.en:
Madlena is 40 years old married woman from Khelvachauri district. She lives with her husband, 3 children and pensioner parents. Madlena is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she owns a plot of land, where she grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables. Madlena sells her agricultural products at the local open market. In addition, she runs a small dairy farm and has a milk cow. Madlena milks the cow twice a day and produces yogurt, which is sold locally. 

She wants to start additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan. With the received credit he will renovate a flat and rent it out in order to generate stable income. She purchased a cow with the Start Up loan 2 years ago and now also awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and generate stable income by renting it out

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Russel works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Russel is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Russel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for shaving and hair cutting for his barber shop

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda esta en los 43 años de edad, ella toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura y en la ganadería, el esposo de Yolanda se dedica a la ganadería y al trabajo al jornal. Yolanda tiene 4 hijos, de ellos solamente uno vive con Yolanda. Ella solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca. Yolanda tiene la aspiración de comprar mas ganado para asi tener mas ingresos de la venta de la leche que se la obtiene de las vacas. Yolanda comenta que trabaja duro para el bienestar de sus hijos y sobre todo del que aun vive con ella.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 43 years old.  She has spent all of her life working in agriculture and with livestock.  Yolanda's husband works with livestock and as a day laborer.  Yolanda has four children, but only one lives with her.  

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of a cow.  Yolanda hopes to purchase more livestock so she can earn more income from selling milk from her cows.  Yolanda says that she works hard for the well-being of her children, especially for the one who still lives with her.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new stock of paint and a dent removal tool for her husband's dent and paint shop.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives in Jrashen village in the Ararat region with his wife and two sons (ages 21 and 22 years old). 
Samvel works at local village municipality as an assistant. Because the work in the office is not too much, most of the day Samvel works with his farm. He keeps a livestock of two cows and three calves. Samvel also gets income from cultivating wheat, potato and cabbage in the family yard. He has been involved in farming business for over 20 years and it has become a part of his life. 

To enlarge the current farm and get more income for his family, Samvel asks lenders to help him with this loan. He plans to purchase  three calves to enlarge the livestock herd and also seeds and forage for land cultivation. 

This is Samvel's  second loan. Unfortunately the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to return back, and he faced some difficulties. However, thanks to his hard work during recent times, Samvel has been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. Samvel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for three calves to enlarge his livestock and also seeds and forage for land cultivation

loans.name: Sav

texts.en:
Sav is a 54-year-old widowed rice farmer with three children in her care, and she lives in a village in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. For more than 15 years, she has cultivated rice. Her three children are working in a factory. Together, they can make around USD $10 each day. 

Sav would like to buy construction materials to renovate her house, but she is short of the finances, so she need a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough construction materials to build a proper house and live in better conditions. In the future, she wants to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to make furniture to sell at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring water into her house. With the financing she will buy pipes and other supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Necefora

texts.en:
Necefora engages in fishing. She sells fish to earn a living. She is a 52 year old woman with no dependents.  

She lives in Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in fishing for three years now. She needs capital to finance her fishing livelihood. She also engages in buying  and selling fresh fish when the catching season is very minimal.

She is asking for a loan  to buy fishing materials like fishing net and to provide additional capital for fish vending. With the presence of these resources, Necefora could improve her ongoing catch.  Thus, her income will be augmented and she will be able to handle her finances.

 In the future, she dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net and to provide additional capital for fish vending business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is thankful that she was granted a 20000 PHP loan which she used to purchase pancakes ingredients and cold drinks needed in her snack business. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 50000 PHP loan which she will use to buy flour, sugar, etc.to make her pancakes and and a sidecar to use to peddle her snacks. Her earnings is her source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Marcelina hopes to buy more sidecars to peddle her snacks to neighboring communities. She also wants to save for her old age. She prays that all her children will finish school to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for pancake ingredients and cold drinks needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production to supply more income gain.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
It’s already June, the official start of rainy season in the Philippines, when it’s dangerous for ordinary fishermen to go fishing. This is the season of costly fish due to its scarcity. Only fishermen with very big fishing boats can safely go to the mid-sea to catch fish.

Agnes, a fish vendor who resides in Santa Barbara, Iloilo, prepares for the impending crisis. She wants to have additional capital of PhP 22,000 to buy volume quantity of fresh fish while it’s still cheap. Particularly she plans to buy loads of tuna from big fishermen in General Santos then distribute this to different places. This additional capital will keep her business running even during rainy season. You can be the answer to her prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance. 

Agnes is married to Jhesser, a driver, and they are blessed with two children. She dreams that her children will finish their college education to give them better chance of abundant life someday. She is a zealous member of CCT where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume quantity of fresh fish and tuna

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlyn is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marlyn has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 31000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marlyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is married with five children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  
 
Melanie support the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

She took an Educational loan for her daughter Jan Nicole, 17 years old and is first of six children in the family, who is studying Bachelor of Science in Nursing and is currently in the fourth of this 4 year course.

Melanie is borrowing Php 24,900 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Jan Nicole for the First Semester of the school year 2015-2016.

when Jan Nicole graduates, she plans to help her parents earn an income to send her brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena works hard to support her family. Ma. Elena is married and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines.

Ma. Elena requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of used clothing to sell.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for 20 years now.

Ma. Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en:
Roselie is married with three children and a member of Kiva's field partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She earns an income for her family by raising and selling pigs in the Philippines.

Roselie’s son Ryan is sixteen years old and the youngest in the family. He is studying for a Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering. The course of study will take four years, and he is presently in his first year.

Roselie is borrowing 10,975 PHP to pay for Ryan’s tuition for fall semester of the school year 2015-2016. When he graduates, Ryan plans to help his parents support the family financially.

loans.use: to pay for her son Ryan's tuition fees

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old and married with two children, who both attend school. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Irene is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Irene has been farming vegetables for four years and earns additional income from frozen food. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dewi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Dewi, one of Ruma’s agents. Dewi is a lady who lives in Lumajang, a regency located in East Java province, Indonesia, about 20 hours by train from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two children. Dewi owns a stall that sells daily consumer products, mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she was interested in Ruma's system. Dewi is a kind and cheerful person. Her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile airtime provider.

As the business grows, Dewi needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Dewi's goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce service for her community, so her community can have access to better products with lower prices. Dewi is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her village community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic crushing raw materialsl for manufacturing plastic accessories through moulding machines by husband.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a game ranger in Lake Mburo National Park and an old client of Ugafode Microfinance who has applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000. 

He is one of the best farmers in Mbarara and has been doing this for more than three  years. The purpose of the loan is to buy cows and clear his farm  so that he can increase the milk output and have healthier cows to maintain and meet his family needs, pay school fees for his siblings, and develop himself. 

Robert is an honest and very hard working person but is always limited by capital. He intends to add cows so that he can increase the profitability of his agriculture.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell

loans.name: Martiros

texts.en:
Martiros lives with his wife and 22-year-old son in Eghegnut village. They raise cattle with the whole family. 

Mostly, they purchase calves every spring and sell them in winter months. Martiros' farm was reduced because of some unexpected costs (Martiros' daughter got married and his son returned from the army). 

He now wants to recover his farming business and that's the reason he applied for this loan. Martiros asks lenders to help him to purchase three calves, forage for feeding the cattle, and fuel to pay for the tractor, as well as to organize land cultivation works, so his farm is recovered. 

This is Martiros' second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which he got from a local financial institution, was very difficult to pay back and he faced some difficulties. However, thanks to his hard work during recent times, Martiros has been able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

Martiros has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for three calves, forage for feeding the cattle, and fuel to pay for the tractor, as well as to organize land cultivation works, so his farm is recovered.

loans.name: Dilaram

texts.ru: Диларам из города Турсунзаде. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Муж занимается плотником. Он любить таких работ. Дети взрослые и помогает родителям в работе. Сама Диларам занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Она 15 лет занимается в этой сфере. Диларам сажает помидоры и болгарские. Она сейчас готовить почву к новому посеву урожай. Ей надо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями для посева урожай. К сожалению, у Диларам нет сумма для приобретения необходимых средств. Она решила обратиться за кредитом. Диларам заранее выражает свою благодарность. Она надеется, что ей помогут с финансовыми трудностями.
texts.en: Dilaram is from the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 47 years old. She is married and has children. Her husband is a carpenter. He loves this type of work. The children are grown up and help their parents at work. Dilaram herself is a farmer. She has been working in this sphere for 15 years. Dilaram plants tomatoes and bell peppers. She is currently preparing her land to sow a new crop. She needs to treat the soil with mineral fertilizer to sow the crop. Unfortunately, Dilaram does not have the sum needed to acquire the material she needs. She has decided to apply for a loan. Dilaram expresses her gratitude in advance. She hopes that she will be helped with her financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 33-year-old married father of three children. Five years ago, he started working as a shepherd in livestock trading to cover his family's needs and expenses. He is a hard worker who has a good reputation in his area.

Ziad is trying hard to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his livestock with more goats and sheep, which will help him in satisfying his customers' needs.
 
Ziad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his shepherding livestock with more goats and sheep to satisfy his customers' needs

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida runs a general store in Badian,Cebu. 

She requested a loan of  PHP8,000 loan through CEVI to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, bath soap detergent, seasoning and shampoo.

Adelaida has been in this business for three years, earning her PHP 8,000 per month.

In the future, Adelaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family. Adelaida is 40 years old.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, bath soap detergent, seasoning and shampoo

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a kind boy. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of farmers. He has faced various hard and challenged situations in his life. Some months ago his father got treatment at hospital because he had a bad eye. 

After graduation of secondary school, he found work to feed and help his parents. His father was the feeder of their family; after his sickness Muhammad got the responsibility to feed his family by himself. He started to work as a rental worker in the domestic market. Then he found work constructing houses and doing renovation. For the income from being a constructor, he treated his father at a medical clinic. 

Recently, his father is well and  together they are working as constructors. He has two years of practice in this sphere and knows this activity very well. 

It is his first time to apply to IMON for a loan. He needs to treat his mother in a hospital. He hopes to have a healthy family and awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to treat his mother in a hospital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some spare parts for the boat, purchase more fish and vegetables

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 42 years old, married to Evans and supports a family of six children. For the last eighteen years she has raised dairy cows, which presently earns her approximately 8,000 KES a month.

Jackline has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Kiva's field partner VisionFund Kenya to buy another dairy cow for more milk production and an increase in her profits. She plans to use the anticipated earnings to educate her children and hopes to open a retail shop and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow for more milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers,animals feeds and licks, feeding troughs and seeds for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of new-arrival clothes

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 35 years old, married to Francis and supports three children. She has been selling clothes in the market for the last three years and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase clothes to sell to clients in the market and meet both family and client needs. 

She plans to use her profits to repay the loan and educate her children. She hopes to be financially stable and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her sugarcane

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs for higher production and more income gain.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is 45 years old with two children in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, eggs, and other groceries.

Saida has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, biscuits, eggs, canned goods, candies, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, eggs, and other groceries

loans.name: Zenny

texts.en:
Zenny is thirty years old and married with two children. For the past two years she has operated her sari-sari, a small general store in the Philippines. She also earns extra income by buying and selling rice.

Zenny has borrowed and successfully repaid three prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy stock for her shop such as beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries. She works continually to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari, or grocery shop

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is a41-year-old single woman who is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Merle has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Merle requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

Merle has been in this business for two years. In the future, Merle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analyn is 27 years old and has three children who are in school.

Analyn has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Analyn has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.and is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Lucresia dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nurul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Nurul, one of Ruma’s agents. Nurul is a lady who lives in Lumajang, a regency located in East Java province, Indonesia, about 20 hours by train from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband. Nurul sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to her house. She decided to join Ruma because she was interested in Ruma's system. Nurul is a kind and cheerful person. Her community sees her as a trusted and friendly mobile airtime provider. 

As the business grows, Nurul needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her community. Nurul's goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce service for her community, so her community can have access to better products with lower prices. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her village community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Warisno

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Warisno, one of Ruma's agents. Warisno lives in Cianjur, a village located in West Java, around 2 hours and 30 minutes from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his three children. Warisno works as an employee in one private company near his house. Right now, he is also becoming a seller of mobile airtime credits for his community. He decided to join Ruma last year because he wants to try to become an entrepreneur, as well as give more contribution to his community. His community also sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Warisno needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Warisno’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later, his community not only can have access to communication service, but also access to get high quality products with lower prices. As seen in the photo, Warisno is the one who is standing. The woman besides him is his wife. Warisno is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to give his village community members better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Hava Özge

texts.en:
Hava Özge is single. She has been making ornaments from felt and other different materials for four years and selling them on stands. Her products are her own designs and she likes to make her own designs. In winter she closes her stand, helps her mother, and sells her products there. 

With the help of the loan she is planning to purchase bulk portions of felt and materials for her ornaments. She wants to open a store where she can design, produce and sell her own products. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hava Özge Hanım bekar. Dört yıldır Keçe ve değişik malzemelerden süs eşyaları yapıp tezgahta satıyor. Yaptığı ürünler tamamen kendi tasarımları üretmeyi seviyor. Tezgah açmadığı kış aylarında hem annesine yardım ediyor hem de ürünlerini burada satıyor. Kredi ile süs eşyası malzemeleri ve keçe alacak. Ürünlerini sergileyebileceği, kişiye özel ürünler tasarlayıp satacağı bir dükkan açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy bulk portions of felt and materials for her ornaments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new Juki sewing machine, some packs of zippers and buttons for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man who started three years ago working in a driving office to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to work independently.

Today, Ahmad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start his own business in cars repairing and trading. He will buy cars, maintain them, and then sell them in good conditions. He has experience in this domain from his father.

Ahmad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions. He also dreams of opening his own driving office.

loans.use: to start his own business in car repairing and trading

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a hard working and zealous woman new to Ugafode Microfinance who has applied for a loan of UGX5000,000. She is a farmer and also runs a transport business of bodaboda transport in the Muko Rubaya arural area in Mbarara and has been doing this for more than two years. This has helped her to make income to meet her family needs, like paying tuition and medical bills for her children. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy farm inputs in the form of organic fertilizers and mulch to increase the yields of her poor performing banana plantation, so that she can increase her earnings to maintain her family, pay school fees for her children and develop herself.  She is the family bread winner after separating with the husband. She is honest, cooperative and a hard working woman, but is always limited by income to improve her business. 

She is so appreciative of the Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers and mulch to improve banana production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay university registration fees for her daughter

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 25-year-old single man who works in furniture-making and selling flowers. He is employed in both businesses to make sure that his income is good enough to cover his expenses and his family's also.
.
At the same time, Alaa is trying hard to develop his own business, thus today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open his own furniture making business and to buy the necessary tools.

Alaa hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to open his own furniture making business and to buy the necessary tools

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Running a “sari-sari” (variety) store is not as simple as others think. Ernesto, 65, has to wake up very early in the morning and sleep late at night in order to meet the demands of customers who sometimes buy as early as 4:30am or as late as 10:30pm. It’s a good thing that his wife, Visminda, lovingly assists him throughout the day. Their usual everyday necessities are being supported by the income from their variety store. 

They have been operating this business for thirty five years and it helped a lot in their children’s education. However, their income is not enough to set aside some savings as they aged. Now that Ernesto and his wife are already in their old age, they still want to improve their business. Ernesto is longing to have additional capital of PhP 12,000 that he will use to buy more dry goods and grocery items for sale in his variety store. He’s aiming that he can save some amount from additional income that will be derived from these goods. He can use the savings as emergency fund in case he or his wife will get sick. He dreams of a longer, happy life without serious illness.

Ernesto is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and he regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods and grocery items for his variety store

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liza is 48 years old and has five children who are in school.

Liza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Liza has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 40 years old and has seven children. Betty is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Betty is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Betty requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Betty has been raising livestock for 15 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Betty would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liza is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Liza has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy meat to sell in the market.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Liza has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell  in the market

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flordeliza is 36 years old and all of her children are attend in school.

Flordeliza has a general store business in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of items like diapers, noodles, canned good and other personal care products to sell.

Flordeliza has been in this business for four years. In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of items like diapers, noodles, canned good and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es: José Eduardo, tiene la edad  de 29 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena geminación y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Eduardo is 29, married, and lives with his wife and children who are his main priority. 

With this loan he plans to buy high quality bean seeds that will germinate well and fertilizers and other products to use on the seeds. He would also pay for workers to apply those products and to help in the field once it is growing.  That way he could be sure of doing a good job. His plan is to take advantage of good climate and soil conditions in the area for this crop and also put to use several years of experience growing basic grains. He will be able to buy better, higher quality products for his crop, have it grow well, be healthy and produce a good harvest and produce well in a short period of time. 

He wants to use the income that he hopes to get from the harvest for the education and well being of his family as well as realize some family goals and continue investing in his crops. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with good conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is aged 53; she is a mother of two children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, as well his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. 

Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Suriya requested a loan for her son so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. She hopes that her son will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. 

Suriyathanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. for her son's general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of tomatoes and vegetables for sale to her clients

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Cost of college education in the Philippines is not a joke. It’s hard to imagine the sacrifices of Marilou, 50 years old, as she tries to provide for her four children who are all studying in college. She praises God that she’s blessed with a responsible husband, Eladio, a driver, who is her companion in all triumphs and trials. They both work consistently to achieve their dream of having professional children. They believe that education is the most valuable inheritance that they can give their children.   

Marilou runs a variety store in Santa Barbara, Iloilo. The store sells various commodities like canned goods, repacked cooking oil, sachets of shampoo and conditioner, packs of condiments and spices, softdrinks, and many others. The profit from her business covers their family expenses, but she hopes to gain more profit so she can better provide for her children’s educational needs. To improve her business, she desires to ask for PhP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy more stocks of items to sell. In the long run, she hopes to expand her store into a big grocery. You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. 

Marilou meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of items for sale in her variety store

loans.name: Wella

texts.en:
One alternative Filipino song dedicated to migrants and overseas Filipino workers has these lyrics “nangangarap ako na ang mga pamilya ay di pinaghihiwalay ng pangangailangan para lamang mabuhay”. Translated in English, it goes like this “I dream that families are not separated by needs just to live”. Wella, 30, from Santa Barbara, Iloilo, Philippines, can sentimentally identify with this song because her husband Romel, also 30, had to leave her and their little child to seek for a more decent wage abroad. It’s difficult for a starting family like hers to be separated from each other. This is why Wella works hard to expand her business of food vending and catering. She hopes that her income would be enough to support all their needs, so that her husband need not work abroad anymore. 

Instead of feeling lonesome due to the absence of her husband, Wella focuses her attention to her business. She harnessed her cooking talent by preparing delicious cuisine, expanded her network and offered catering services to them. But catering service is occasional and income is unstable. It’s best for her to have as many clients as possible even if there would be two or more occasions or catering requests at the same time. It would bring her more profit. Her only problem is the limited utensils, equipments, tables and chairs to be used for simultaneous occasions. She humbly requests for a PhP 38,000 loan to buy all these things. She may also need to hire occasional waiters and helpers. Hope you could be God’s instrument to grant her request and contribute few steps to make her family whole someday. 

Wella draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more utensils, equipments, tables and chairs for her catering service

loans.name: Bevena

texts.en:
Bevena is 48 years old, married with four children.

Bevena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Bevena has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Bevena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 57 year old married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rufina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Rufina requested an 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rufina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of one child, Maria Carmen works hard to support her family.

She has a personal product care business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Maria Carmen is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, make-up, etc. for her personal product care business.

Maria Carmen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, make-up, etc.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
