Natividad is 57 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Natividad works very hard to provide for them.

Natividad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Natividad has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Natividad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 62 years old, married with three children.

Chita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Chita has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Chita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita is 57 years old now.

Nenita has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 33 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been in pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a resident of Teso bar, Lira municipality and is a single lady who has devoted her efforts to looking after her siblings using income generated through farming of such crops like soya beans, ground nuts, simsim, oranges and coffee seedlings.

Eunice has applied for a loan of UGX2,000,000 to help boost her agriculture farm in puts by buying coffee seedlings and fertilizers to have improved yields.
She is so grateful to Kiva lenders and UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI)for the support given that will help her realize her dream of educating her siblings and improved standards of living for her family.

Pictured is Eunice with the Ugafode credit officer in charge of her loan.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Ermoda

texts.en:
Ermoda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ermoda is 48 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ermoda has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines. Ermoda requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods like slippers, sandals, bags, etc. to sell.

Ermoda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ermoda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods like slippers, sandals, bags, etc. to sell

loans.name: Chanthan

texts.en:
Chanthan is 33 years old and widowed with five children in her care. She resides in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. With a motorcycle and a trailer, she has operated the business of selling coconuts since 2014, earning around $10 per day. Four of her children attend school. 

Chanthan's motorcycle and the trailer are old, so she is now requesting a loan because she needs finances to purchase a newer motorcycle with a trailer to transport coconuts to sell in her community. With this loan, she will be able to afford a new motorcycle and a trailer to transport coconuts to sell in order to earn income to support her family. In the future, she wants to buy farmland, build fences around her house and support all the children to go through high school.

loans.use: to purchase a newer motorcycle with a trailer to transport coconuts to sell

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Это женщина на фотке Адолат.  Она семейная женщина, и у нее трое детей. Детям 25, 23 и 20 лет. Они находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Старший сын женат. Сам находится вдали от семьи, а жена живет с мамой. Адолат с невесткой занимается один видом бизнесом. Они продают разную одежду. У них нет место торговли. Адолат перевезет одежду из города Худжанд и Душанбе, потом  перепродает  их клиентом. У нее имеется много и постоянные клиенты. Некоторые время Адолат ходит по домам, чтобы продавать одежды. Она решила арендовать место для продажи одежды и перевозить больше осеннюю одежду на продажу. Для данной операции у Адолат нет денежных средств. Она решила взять кредит, и по этой причине Адолат обратилась к Вам за кредитом.
texts.en: The woman in this photo is Adolat. She is a family woman, and she has three children. Her children are 25, 23 and 20 years old. They are away working in the Russian Federation. Her eldest son is married. He is far away from the family, and his wife lives with his mother. Adolat and her daughter-in-law are engaged in the same type of business. They sell various clothes. They do not have a retail outlet. Adolat brings clothing from the cities of Khujand and Dushanbe then resells them to her clients. She has many regular clients. At times Adolat goes round people's houses to sell clothes. She has decided to rent a place to sell the clothes and buy in more fall clothing for sale. Adolat lacks the funds for this operation. She has decided to take a loan, and for this reason Adolat has turned to you.

loans.use: to pay for a rented retail point and buy in fall clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm equipment like weeding hoes and shovels

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Hog raising combined with chicken raising are practical endeavors that will surely alleviate food shortage in the community. Ofelia is into this business for eight years, and she’s convinced that it is such a profitable enterprise that offers affordable food for the community. Her income from this business helped sustain their daily needs and the education of her two children. Despite the death of her husband some years ago, she remained strong and carried on with all her responsibilities as solo parent. She lives in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental together with her children. 

Now that Ofelia aims to distribute bigger volume of affordable pork and chicken within the community, she wants to buy a cart that she can use for delivery. She would like to ask for PhP 34,000 loan for this purpose. She also plans to renovate the roof of her pigpen soon, in order to avoid the common illnesses of pigs. Not only this, she hopes to buy laying hens so she can sell chicken eggs in the near future. She really doesn’t stop dreaming. Hope you are willing to help a widow like her attain her dreams, and give her a little comfort in life.
 
She shares her experiences and aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy a cart for the delivery of pigs or pork meat and to repair the pigpen

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a bread vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more bread to sell to her customers for her bread vending business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 69 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 46 years old and married with five children. Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Kristine Marie

texts.en:
Kristine Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Kristine Marie has been in this business for 9 years. Kristine Marie earns more income from general store.

Kristine Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 49 years old with one child.

Rhodora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Rhodora has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rhodora aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, eggs, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.ru: Это мужчина Иброгим. Он семейный мужчина. У него трое детей. Детям 30, 28 и 24 лет. Сыновья находятся на заработках загранице, чтобы зарабатывать и помочь отцу обеспечить семью.  Имрогим водитель грузового автомобиля марки «КАМАЗ». Он опытный и профессиональный  водитель. Иброгим 20 лет занимается водителем. Он с помощью грузовика зарабатывает на жизнь, и его грузовик является единственным источником дохода. Иброгим перевозить щебень, песок и камни на заказ. Его грузовик находится в мастерской, потому что он сломался. Иброгиму надо его починить, потому что он данный момент без работы. Для восстановления грузовика Иброгиму нужны запчасти, но для автозапчасти у него нет денег.  По этой причине Иброгим просит кредит. Его единственный вариант взять кредит. Поддержите его!
texts.en: This man is Ibrogim. He is a family man. He has three children who are 30, 28 and 24 years old. His sons are away working abroad in order to earn money and help their father to provide for the family. Ibrogim is the driver of a Kamaz brand truck. He is an experienced and professional driver. Ibrogim has been a driver for 20 years. He makes his living with the help of the truck, and his truck is his sold source of income. Ibrogim transports gravel, sand and stones to order. His truck is in the shop because it has broken down. Ibrogim needs to repair it because he is without work at the moment. Ibrogim needs spare parts for the repairs, but he does not have money for them. Ibrogim is asking for a loan for this reason. His only option is to take a loan. Please support him!

loans.use: to repair his truck.

loans.name: Rencie

texts.en:
A lot more waits to Rencie as she started improving her business through your granted loan worth PHP 50,000. Because of your wide and helping hands, Rencie was able to increase profit from her enterprise, thus, engaging her family to have a little better daily living condition than usual. 

She wants to continue the race, and so, she is asking for a loan worth PHP 50,000 that she would surely use to purchase more quantity of selling products like curtains, fabrics and other textile product sales. This can be a good opportunity for her as she tries to explore different avenues to success. By now, she just prays that your unwavering support for her won't vanish. 

With a vision in mind to strive her children to finish schooling, she does everything she can to support them all the way. To a woman who is determined to win, nothing is a failure, but a delayed success.

She meets up weekly with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for textiles and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Nisaa Amelat Group

texts.en:
Wafaa is the featured borrower for Nisaa Amelat Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Wafaa is a 28-year-old married mother of two children. Due to the increasing expensive living conditions, her husband's salary is not enough anymore to satisfy his family's needs, thus she decided to help him through opening her own business. 

Thus today, Wafaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start her own business of selling mobile prepaid cards. She hopes to succeed in her business to stay capable of satisfying her family's needs. Wafaa is the lady sitting in the middle.
With respect to the other group members, Nawal is the first lady on the left of the photo and Wafaa is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to start her own business of selling mobile prepaid cards

loans.name: Shahzia

texts.en:
Shahzia is a 40 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two sons and three daughters and her children are in school. Her husband has been running her own business of clothes selling for 7 years and he is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore Shahzia is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 
Shahzia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa and her husband live in Ayntap village of the Ararat region. Larisa runs a farming business and her husband is a driver. In the family yard, Larisa cultivates wheat, sunflower and greens. She sells the gathered harvest in the local market and gets a small but important income for family.  To enlarge her agricultural business Larisa needs some help on the farm. She asks lenders to support her financially to purchase fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation works.
 
Unfortunately the previous loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to return back, and Larisa faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Larisa and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

Larisa has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and hiring workers for land cultivation work

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is from Stepanavan, where she lives with her husband and 23-year-old daughter. Her husband works with wood, and makes very interesting things (stone crosses, backgammon games, etc.). Their daughter studies in college and specializes in agribusiness.
 
Jemma is self employed on her farm. She has only two cows and calves, from which she gets milk and meat, which she sells in the local market. Jemma has asked for this loan enlarge her farming business. She plans to purchase three calves, two cows, and one mother pig. 

This is Jemma's second loan. Unfortunately the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to repay, and Jemma faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work recently, Jemma and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. Jemma has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for three calves, two cows, and one mother pig

loans.name: Olfat

texts.en:
Olfat is a 37-year-old married mother of three children. Fifteen years ago, she started preparing "Mouneh" (traditonal pickles) to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has professional skills in this domain. She learned preparing "Mouneh" from her mother.

Olfat is trying hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a chiller to store her products and an oven which will improve her production.

Olfat hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a chiller to store her traditional pickles and an oven to improve her production

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.en:
Rustamjon is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1960 and is now living in a small town with his family. He is married and has three children. His wife is working at medical center as a nurse. He graduated university with excellence with the major of power engineering
specialist. He entered to government agency and works recently there. He is well known and bright employee. 
When he gave his daughter in marriage he flew to Russia to work. 

He is asking financial support to pay his for daughter nursing tuition fee. He each year sends money to his family.  He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders. The photo is of him and his daughter..

loans.use: to pay his daughter's tuition fee in nursing.

loans.name: Neslie

texts.en:
Contribute now for Neslie. Recently, she was granted a loan amounting PHP 35,000 which she used for improving her inventory. With heartfelt thanks, she would like to avail another loan worth PHP 50,000. This time, she will utilize this to add many grocery items for her sari-sari store business. 

Surely, this loan, if granted, will help sustain the family needs basically their main expenses for everyday living. She is hopeful that through your helping hands, she will be able to expand her trade someday. 

She simply prays to succeed in life and have more branches someday . She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages which she needs in her business to increase profit.

loans.name: Eranuhi

texts.en:
Eranuhi has a big and beautiful farm in Gusanagyugh village of Shirak region. 
She keeps there a livestock (4 cows, calves, 6 sheep, 2 pigs and 10 piglets) and also cultivates wheat and barley. 
Eranuhi's husband is big support for her in farming activities. They sell the gathered farming products in the market and that's the main source of their income. 

To be able to enlarge the farm, Eranuhi asks this loan. She plans to purchase two sows, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation.
 
Because the region where Eranuhi's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high; people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Eranuhi's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for two sows, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more slippers, which she will sell.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 44 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. Бурулкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 5 коров, 30 овец и 3 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита Бурулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, чтобы накопить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Burulkan is 44 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Burulkan rears animals, having started five years ago. Thanks to Burulkan's hard work, at present she has five cows, thirty sheep and three horses. In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock for breeding. Burulkan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further expanding her business in order to save up to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Obra 2 Group

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman from Teshie in Accra, and she belongs to Obra 2 Group.  Her 3 children are all going to school. She sells foodstuff at her residence in Teshie-Nungua
Obra 2 Group has applied for a loan of GHS 2500. Florence will use her loan portion to boost her business by buying more cassava, plantain, vegetables and fish to sell. She believes with more capital she will be able to save some money to reinvest back into her business. Florence will be assured of boosting her income and improving her standard of living. She, along with the other group members, are thankful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more cassava, plantain, vegetables and fish to sell.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en: Ema is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Kyasge Village. Ema joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ema will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ema now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Alhaji Tsalha

texts.en: Alhaji Tsalha is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Lili Village. Alhaji Tsalha joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alhaji Tsalha will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Alhaji Tsalha now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting so as to get food to feed his family and the surplus for sale in the market.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Gogarma Village. Augustine joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Augustine will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Augustine now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Hawraa

texts.en:
Hawraa is an 18-years-old single lady who studied beauty care at an institute. She is a talented lady who loves this domain very much. She has professional skills in making tattoos and laser.

Today, Hawraa is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a laser machine to start working on her own. This loan is very important to Hawraa for it will help her make a step forward and start working independently.
Hawraa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a laser tattoo machine to start working on her own

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is living with her husband and three children in Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is 29 years old and is managing a direct-selling business. 

She sells products for men, women, and children, like soap, lotion, perfume, clothes, shoes, sandals, and cosmetics. She has had this business for five years. She found it interesting because she can earn income in an easy way through her good and effective salesmanship. 

Evelyn requested a loan to purchase more stocks to offer to her customers. Expanding her inventory would also mean an increase to her income. 

Evelyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for four years. In the future, she hopes to arrange a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly, age 49, is from Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines.  She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband is a farmer who plants, rice, corn and vegetables. Helping the family survive, she run a sari-sari store and patiently tend her store. 

Beverly is now trying to expand her business and has decided to loan an amount to restock her store with various commodities and purchase of fertilizers. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs.  With her extra income, she wishes to save for future emergencies and repair her house.

loans.use: to restock her store with various commodities and purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 58 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children now at their adult age. 
Elma is engaged in hog fattening activity for 15 years already. She is also earning support from her daughter working abroad and a son who is a member of the Philippine Coast Guard.  She earns approximately PHP10,000.00 each month. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials particularly cement, sand and gravel, corrugated bars and hollow blocks for house repair and renovations. 
Elma has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Elma hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing construction materials particularly cement, sand and gravel, corrugated bars and hollow blocks

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1990 and is now living in small mountainous town. She is divorced and has one child. She is a business woman. She has a beauty salon, where she serves Tajik women with wedding dresses, manicure, pedicure, make up and women's hairstyling. She is an experienced and professional specialist in this sphere. She learned from a famous beauty salon in Tashkent (Uzbekistan). 

After getting qualified skills, she opened her own beauty salon in her area. She wants to widen her assortment of wedding dresses. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to buy new wedding dresses. She hopes to be supported. This business helps her to ensure her family and for living.

loans.use: to buy new wedding dresses to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is a farmer living in Aknalij village of Armavir region.  She has a farm where she keeps a small cattle of  calves, one pig and 20 hens. She also cultivates tomato and sells it in the local market. 

Susanna asks this loan to purchase fertilizer, natural pesticides and to hire workers to organize cultivation works. 
This will be a big support for her agribusiness to develop it and gather income for her family's living. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and little grandchild. 

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Susanna get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Susanna hopes to receive lenders' support and develop her farm.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, natural pesticides and hire workers to organize cultivation works

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a 42 year farmer in Mariakani Kenya. She is a married mother of three whose husband gives additional income and has been in the agribusiness for the last ten years doing well.

This marks her fifth borrowing from Visionfund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase animal feeds that is for poultry and pigs that she is rearing and the anticipated will plough back into the business to increase her farm pigs and birds. 

Sophia he hopes to be the best farmer in her community and have a learning center.

loans.use: to purchase food for poultry and pigs to be the best farmer in her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bull for slaughter for meat so as to meet client needs in meat supply.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en:
Mayram is from Armavir town where she is involved in a clothing selling business.  From the rented store in the center of Armavir town, she trades with clothing for children and adults. She has now applied for this loan to purchase new stock of clothing to sell from her store. This loan will be a huge support for Mayram's business to develop it and meet her customers' demand.
 
This is Mayram's second loan. Unfortunately the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to repay, and Mayram faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Mayram  has been able to run her business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. Mayram has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing supplies to sell to her customers and meet their needs

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “San Judas Tadeo” conformada por 07 socias entusiastas que en el transcurso del tiempo han demostrado que son personas responsables. Ella es Yolanda una de las socias de 30 años de edad, conviviente con dos hijos dependientes. Con  deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida Yolanda pone un negocio de venta de comidas desde hace 7 años que tiene dicho negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de pollo, arroz, aceite y papas. El grupo “San Judas Tadeo” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Yolanda se encuentra en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado derecho y viste chompa color plomo a rayas.
texts.en:
This is the "San Judas Tadeo" group, made up of seven enthusiastic members who have demonstrated over time that they are responsible people. 

Yolanda is one of the members. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has two dependent children. With a desire to improve her quality of life, Yolanda has been running a food sales business for seven years. She will use her most recent loan to purchase chicken, rice, oil, and potatoes. 

The "San Judas Tadeo" group is very thankful to the people of Kiva who made this loan possible, because it allows them to keep improving. 

Yolanda can be seen in the back of the photo, second from the right and wearing a grey sweater with stripes.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, rice, oil, and potatoes.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 54 years old with six children. Daisy personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 12,000.00 for the purchase of new nets.  As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  

In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: purchase of new fishing nets

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en: Rose Ann wants to fulfill her dreams by completing  a degree. She religiously pays attention on making a good mark to every semester she entered. For another school year, Rose Ann is in need of an amount to pay for her school fees. Rose Ann has big dreams to help her family and for her siblings as well, reason why she works hard for her education

loans.use: to pay for her school fees

loans.name: Herviwinda

texts.en: Herviwinda is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. Herviwinda hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of Php 35,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record. Matter that Herviwinda has given a priority of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business where supported by PMPC.

loans.use: for her house renovation

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina has started her small time business and became profitable with her sari-sari store. She has manage to have enough inventories and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she made good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. 

Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1987 and is living in a remote district with her family. From her early age she was an active and responsible girl. She has many years of practice doing business in domestic market. She bought and sold diverse items at her business experience. 

Recently, she is busy with buying and selling women clothing. Her goods are differing with high quality and low price. She is gentle and communicable seller and has regular customers every day. For the coming season she needs to buy a new assortment of clothes in season. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to buy assortment of women clothes. She awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothes for the season

loans.name: Marjina

texts.en:
Marjina is a 23-year-old hardworking woman; she always goes in search of alternatives that will allow her to move forward. She lives in Falakata with her family. She is married and the mother of a school-going son. In her young age, Marjina received limited education due to her family's poor economic resources.

Marjina's husband is a driver by profession, and Marjina runs a microenterprise of sewing attire as well as market bags. She adapted a space in her house, and with some savings, she bought her first sewing machine. She stitches different items as per the order of her customers. Now she needs to buy a modern sewing machine to do her sewing work fast and smooth.

Thus, she is applying for an enterprise loan from BJS (Kiva’s field partner) to elevate her business and ease the production process. This will allow her to get more contracts, making her business more profitable.

Marjina appreciates the financial support of her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her sewing work business.

loans.name: Maleka

texts.en:
Maleka is a 45-year-old, active married lady from a small village, Boro Shoulmari, in West Bengal. She belongs to a poor family. Her family comprises her husband and one daughter, who is married.

The main source of income for her family is from cycle-van service. Her husband is a cycle-van puller and offers transportation services to the villagers. A cycle-van is a cycle-operated van used for carrying loads and people, especially in rural areas. Her husband has been doing this work for many years, but his income is very nominal, so, for additional income, Maleka sells betel nuts to the villagers.

To earn some more income, she and her husband decided to buy a new cycle-van. Therefore, Maleka applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for developing their existing enterprise. Maleka will use this loan for purchasing a new cycle-van. After purchasing the new van, she will hire out the old cycle-van for extra income.

In the future, Maleka dreams to purchase a Toto van (a battery-operated auto rickshaw van) for their business. This will help her to generate some extra income, and she will be able to provide financial sustenance to her family.

Maleka will be ever grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy  a new cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 40 years old, married to Naftal and she supports 6 children. 

She has been a farmer for the last 8 year and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops for a better harvest and meet family needs in food use.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops for a better harvest and meet family needs in food use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers so as to improve his agricultural produce for sale in the market after harvest and meet client needs

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a young man aged 24 and is passionate about entrepreneurship. He enrolled at a technical institution to acquire skills in electrical installation. He has been engaging in various businesses to finance his school fees. In order to add value to the vocational training skills offered to students, the technical institution partnered with Junior Achievement Kenya to compliment their studies by provide entrepreneurship program. The program focuses on equipping students with skills in entrepreneurship, financial literacy and work readiness.  The institution allows all final year students to participant in the program. Through the training Robert has gained more knowledge in how to run a business especially in the areas of marketing and financial management. The most important lesson that he learnt was to understand the principle of saving as well as retaining profits in the business. 

He is currently selling variety of second hand shoes for ladies, children and men. He wants to grow his shoe business by increasing the number of outlets he is operating from. This loan will enable him to increase his stock.

loans.use: to increase his stock of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in goats, vitamins, and concentrated feed in order to sell goat milk.

loans.name: Nozanin

texts.en:
Nozanin is a cheerful girl. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1995. She is living in big busy city with her family. She is single and lives with her parents. 

She is a second year student at the Medical Government College. She is an active student and well known among friends and course mates. She is learning how to create a tooth. She has a dream to be qualified and have a dental profession. 

She appealed to IMON asking financial support to help pay her tuition fees. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee for studies in dentistry

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and married with one child. The family lives in Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Gemma has a space where she displays her fish to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years already, earning a good return, enabling her to support the needs of their family. Since she wants to generate more income, Gemma joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. 

She has now applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she can become a successful vendor someday and eventually a fish stockholder in the public market at nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Godofreda

texts.en:
Godofreda is from the village of Larena, Siquijor.She owns and operates a sari-sari store business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years. In 2008, Godofreda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Godofreda is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 34 years old and she supports 2 children. 

She has been practicing agriculture and later selling her agricultural produce such as sugarcane in the market for 4 year and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her sugarcane for an improved harvest for sale in the market and meet client needs.
 
She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children.
 
She hope is to be financially stable and start a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her sugarcane for an improved harvest for sale in the market and meet client needs

loans.name: Rasida

texts.en:
Rasida is a diligent woman of 42 years. She is from a small village named Paschim Falakata of Alipuduar district in West Bengal, India. She has four children (a son and three daughters). Though Rasida is illiterate (only can sign her name), she is providing good education to her children. They are students of grades B.A., 11, and 12 respectively. She is married to Akhtar, who is engaged in a rickshaw renting business.

Rasida has been practicing cattle breeding to give financial sustenance to her family through a dairy business. She finds dairy farming profitable. She has dairy cows and supplies milk to her neighbors. In order to increase her business, she needs to purchase one more cow, but the biggest challenge she faces is her limited funds.

So, Rasida is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy another dairy cow to produce enough milk. She hopes it will enable her to supply more milk and satisfy her customers so that she will earn more. She wants to ensure her family is economically stable and organize her business in more effective ways.

She gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Bas  Pari

texts.en:
Bas Pari is a married woman and is shown in the photo with her son; he runs a workshop of vehicle repairing.  He earns a good amount of income to run their household expenses. 

For the improvement of her son’s business, Bas Pari has availed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. In this way her son will be able to purchase a new welding machine, along with spare parts for his workshop to cater his customers’ needs, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a new welding machine along with spare parts for her son's workshop

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.en:
Shohsanam is a bright woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1989. She is living in a remote district with her family, where there are good conditions to do business in agriculture. She is married and has children. 

Her husband works abroad and sends his family money. She has an activity of keeping livestock and well knows how to take care after livestock and planting. Her brother-in-law helps her to do business. 

She is asking financial support from Kiva and IMON to buy fertilizer, seeds and natural chemicals. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and natural chemicals

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Corina ella es soltera y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de helados,la socia vende helados de diferentes sabores como fressa,chocolate y vainilla, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de helados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar helados de fresa,chocolates y vainilla.



Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “Senor De Huanca.”  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Senora Corina is single, thirty-seven years old and has two children.  She works selling different flavours of ice-cream such as strawberry, chocolate and vanilla.  She works from 8:00AM until 5:00PM.  She has already spent several years in this business and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her ice-cream business.  She is requesting a loan to buy strawberry, chocolate and vanilla ice-cream.

The other members have an internet business, a business selling animals, a grocery store and a food business.

Corina is grateful to those who form part of this dream in this way and she commits to making her loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy strawberry, chocolate and vanilla ice cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy trees seedlings for supply for more income gain

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en: This is Andranik's second loan from Kiva. He still studies at university and asks for this second loan for his second semester. As a reliable and responsible client, with good credit payment behind him, Andranik hopes to receive lenders' support and pay for his university tuition.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition for the second semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops for a better harvest to sell  in the market

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 33 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Liana lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two children in Spitak town.  Together with her mother-in-law, Susanna has her own business, selling food products. This is a main source of income for her family, which she started five years ago. 

With an aim to further develop her food selling business, Liana asks for this loan to purchase a new stock of food supplies for selling in the store. 

Liana has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of food supplies for selling in the store

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 21-year-old married man who was employed as a blacksmith, but three years ago he started his blacksmith business from his house. He is a very talented man who has professional skills in this domain.

Today, Hussein is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open his own blacksmith shop which will facilitate his work and help him provide his customers with better service.

Hussein hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to open his own blacksmith shop to increase his income and living conditions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 28-years-old single man from Khan younis city. He would like to improve himself and be independent so he decided to start selling water toys on the beach. He thinks that the demand will be very high especially that the summer began.

Abdullah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy the toys and the stall for his new business. this will improve his economic conditions.
Abdullah appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy the water toys and the stall for his new business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Musaler village, where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law and three children (23,15 and 11 years old). Her husband works at a local water station as a laborer. Anna herself is self-employed on their family farm. She has seven calves, seven pigs and 32 piglets and also cultivates wheat, barley and okra, which she sells in local markets.

Anna wants to improve her farming business, and that's the reason why she applied for this loan. She asks lenders to help her to purchase a hand haymaker to make her cultivation work efficient and easier.

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Anna get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Anna hopes to receive lenders' support and develop her farm.

loans.use: to pay for a hand haymaker to make her cultivation work efficient and easier

loans.name: Noami

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with one dependable child . She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Naomi is 41 years old and her child is attending school.
Naomi has been selling smoked fish for 15 years in Accra. 

Naomi requested a GHS 4,000 loan amount through ID-Ghana in order to buy more fish and fire wood to smoke fish to sell to her customers.
Naomi has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Naomi would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her child to school.

loans.use: To buy more fish and fire wood to smoke fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 40-year-old single lady who started twenty one years ago selling clothes and working as a hairdresser from her house to cover her needs and expenses. She is an independent and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business and improve her living conditions.
 
Today, Lina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car in order to provide her customers with better and quick service. This loan will help her visit her customers' houses and deliver items to them. 

Lina hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car in order to provide her customers with quick service

loans.name: God Is Good Group

texts.en:
Nancy is the woman standing in the middle of the photo. She is a trader selling shirts, 35 years old, and the married mother of two children. These children are 9 and 18 years old and are both school-aged and attending school.

Nancy was taken out of school after her marriage. She has been selling shirts for three years. As always, she buys her supplies from the local markets and resells door-to-door.

She has turned to the financial services of the microfinance institution ID Ghana to support her business through the purchase of shirts to sell to her customers. Her goal is to be better organized and to generate much more profit for the sake of her children’s well-being (clothing, food, healthcare, education). She projects a good monthly profit.

Together with her colleagues, they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan. The group members sell charcoal, salt, eggs, foodstuffs, shirts, and second-hand clothing.

loans.use: to purchase shirts and sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna lives with her parents in Vanadzor town.
Her mother makes different type of souvenirs from polymeric and Syuzanna takes them to market for souvenirs and sells them there. Her mother is talented woman who is involved in making works for already 40 years. 

Syuzanna has now applied for this loan to ask lenders help her with their business. She plans to purchase raw materials for making different types of souvenirs and selling them to customers. Syuzanna has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials for making different type of souvenirs and selling them to customers

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en:
Clovice is a 37 year old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a retailer and at the same time earns a salary after working as a teacher. He faces challenges of competition and price fluctuations of retail products that hinder growth of his business. 

However, he has future goals of completing construction of his residential house. Clovice needs a loan to  buy stock of sugar, cooking oil and soap for selling.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, cooking oil and soap for sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 28 year old hardworking man with 2 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He sells clothes, owns a motorcycle that brings him weekly income and tea farming. He faces hardships of low capital that hinder expansion of his businesses. 

However, he is working very hard to have a well established business as he expands his tea plantation to harvest big and increase his profits. Robert needs a loan to buy green tea plants for growing.

loans.use: to buy green tea plants for growing

loans.name: Alh. Musa

texts.en: Alh. Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Katsalle Village. Alh. Musa  joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alh. Musa will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Alh. Musa now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a woman with one dependable child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rebecca is 32-years-old and her four children are in school.

Rebecca has a buy and sell plates, cups, saucepans and fish business in Ghana. Rebecca has requested a GHS 2,200 loan amount through Kiva partner ID-Ghana in order to buy more plates, cups, sauce pan and fish and sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy more plates, cups, saucepans and fish to sell.

loans.name: Five Star School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Julius. He is the Director of Five Star Model Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kasese with 600 students. Five Star School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Five Star School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Julius ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 68 years old, married and supports a family of 3 children. 

He has been operating in his retail cloth business for the last 27 years earning KES 14,000 per month. 

Philip has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of print fabrics, kente fabrics and tie and dye fabrics for resale.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to open a call center in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of print fabrics, kente fabrics and tie and dye fabrics for resale

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha, who is in his mid 30s is married with three children who are still at school.  He has been selling second hand clothes for eight years now.  He works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Twaha's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase on the second has clothing sells and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loans and to covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase on his second has clothing sells.  He dreams of buying a plot of land and build his own house.

Twaha will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase on his second hand clothing sales.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 25 years old, single man and he supports two family members.He has been a farmer for the last one year and the business earns him KES 8,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and start a retail shop.His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income gain.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old, married to Margaret and he supports three children.He has been a farmer for the last 23 years and the business earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children.His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 52 years, married to Veronicah and he supports 7 family members. 

He has been a dairy farmer for the last 28 year and the business earns him KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.  

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 31 year old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of running a bar and also has a pool table that add him more income. He started these businesses with a hope of earning an income. 

Anthony meets a difficulty of high taxes imposed on his products especially the beers,wines and spirits. He has asked for a loan to buy sodas, beers, wines and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beers, wines and spirits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds for planting and then high production

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Fifty-nine years old Porferia runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells various commodities ranging from biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, beverages, and toiletries. She  is married  with two grown children from Antequera, Bohol. Almost 12 years now that she has been operating a sari-sari(variety) store. 

Porferia is asking for a loan to  purchase various kinds of drinks. These will keep maintain the stocks of her store. It could attract more customers to buy. Thus, it creates to augment her income and able to balance her finances. With these, she could be able to start expand her business and try to develop other possible business ventures.

In the future, Porferia is hoping that she could improve her business to be  sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase various kinds of drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa works in agriculture farming food.

Hoa is 49 years old and is married with one child.
Hoa lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes to maintain a successful business and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 28 Minh Hợp Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Nhượng has a retail business selling coal. She is requesting a loan to purchase coal to resell.

Nhượng is 49 years old and is married with three children.
Nhượng is the group leader of the Nhóm 28 Minh Hợp Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2009, Nhượng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business Nhượng has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Nhượng has been involved in this business for eight years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhượng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase coal to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase digging hoe and fork hoe for cultivating and preparing her farm in preparation for planting

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking female entrepreneur with two children.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices and vegetables to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leonora dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Vilma is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional items for her business like nail color, etc. for her manicure and pedicure business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her business like nail color, etc.

loans.name: Ruelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ruelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell home product care business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Ruelita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  buy items to sell like rice cooker, etc. for her buy and sell home product care business.

Ruelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice cooker, etc.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her four children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family, and her husband has been running a mobile phone shop for past 5 years.
 
Irshad's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Irshad has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business purpose so that her husband can earn more profitable income to manage his business and house hold.

Irshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's mobile phone business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Teresita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 44 years old and has two children. Nora is married and has two children who are in school.

Nora is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Nora requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nora has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Group Mujeres De Guatemaya (Women Of Guatemala)

texts.en:
The six members of this group live in Caserio Chuinahualate, a small village that is part of the town of Guineales, Department of Suchitepéquez, Guatemala. This is an agricultural area where coffee and bananas are grown. Among these women, five weave, embroider and/or sell traditional clothing.  The sixth sells medicines popular in her area. The women are looking forward to their work with Namaste as they want to learn how to manage their sales and expenses.  They are eager to grow their businesses with the help of the business adviser who will provide them with a business plan and monthly advice on improving their business.
Lidia Marceleana (first from left) was elected president of the group because of the leadership skills she demonstrated.  She is 21 years old, single and has no children. She has high school training to be a teacher but because she was unable to find work she opened her business selling traditional clothing.  Her dream is to earn enough profit to go to university and finish her studies as a teacher. With her loan she plans to add baby slings, diapers and bras to the items she has in her store. With her additional profit she plans to grow her business and save money so she can pay to go to the university.
She currently has a monthly net profit of 3,188 GTQ (Guatemalan quetzales) per month, working 200 hours.  She is projecting a net profit of 5,045 GTQ by the end of her nine-month cycle with Namaste.

loans.use: to add baby slings, diapers and bras to the items she has in her store.

loans.name: Shahzia

texts.en:
Shahzia is 35 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son and three daughters, her children are in school. 

Her husband has been running her own business of clothes selling for 6 years and he is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore Shahzia is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 
Shahzia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Nhóm 13 Tiền Phong, Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tiến is 58 years old and she is married.
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodles for 7 years.  Tiến lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in a village. She has no collateral cause and cannot get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.
The main hardship that Tiến faces is lack of capital.  Her income was very low and unstable.

She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to cook noodles (pho) for sale in the evenings.

In 2014, Tiến joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to open a store selling noodles in the evening. Tiến has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Her family's income has improved greatly
.
With her business profit, Tiến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of noodles (pho) for sale in the evening and to support her family

loans.name: Mikoroshini Group

texts.en:
Shida, who is in her early 30s, is single with three children, who are still at school.  She has been a food vendor for ten years now.  She works from 8am to 4pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Shida's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep increasing and improving her mamalishe business and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  

She used the profit to pay school fees, paid rent for her business shop, bought a TV set, a radio, cupboards for utensils and clothes to repay loan and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase on her mamalishe stock and to start selling different types of meals like cassava meal, wheat meal, mashed bananas, sweet potatoes etc.   She dreams of building her own house.

Shida will share this loan with her loan group  Mikoroshini which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on mamalishe stock and to start seling tradtional meals like cassava meal, wheat meal, mashed bananas, sweet potatoes etc.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 ,phố Tân Nam, Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Phương is 30 years old and married.
She has had a retail business for six years, selling food such as cake, sweets, sugar, milk and general items.
Phương lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village and her job is unstable. She has no collateral and can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.
The main hardship that Phương faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk  to resell.
In 2012, Phương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Phương has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweet, suger, milk,... to resell

loans.name: 21 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Tỉnh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry chicks to raise and sell in future.

Tỉnh is 46 years old and married with five children.
Tỉnh is the group leader of the 21 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Tỉnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Tỉnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Tỉnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tỉnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry chicks to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Muliati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Muliati, one of Ruma’s agents. Muliati is a lady who lives in Lumajang, a regency located in East Java province, Indonesia, about 20 hours by train from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two children. Muliati owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to her stall. Muliati is a kind and hardworking person. Her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile airtime provider. 

As the business grows, Muliati needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her community. Muliati's goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce service for her community, so her community can have access to better products with lower prices. Muliati is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her village community.

loans.name: Pek

texts.en:
Pek is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 29 years old, is married and lives in a wooden one floor house  with her husband and their 2 children. Her family owns 5 hectares of rice fields and recently bought 1 hectare of cassava. 

In 2002 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. PEK makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for fertilizer to use in their fields and family expenses. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Norverta

texts.en:
Norverta is 43 years old and has seven children.  Norverta is married and has five children who are in school.
