Norverta is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Norverta requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Norverta has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Norverta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Fanaka Kajiungeni Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his mid 20s is single with one daughter who is still small.  He has been selling fruits, vegetables in a shop for one year now.  He works from 8am to 7pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mohamed's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to buy the best selling items in his gengeduka and meet his customer's demand.  He dreams of having a big capital and make his genge into a supermarket.

Mohamed will share this loan with his loan group  Fanaka Kajiungeni which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best selling items in his gengeduka and meet his customer's demand.

loans.name: 20 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lành works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Lành is 56 years old and she is married with 1 child.  Lành is the group leader of the 20 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2012, Lành joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Lành has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  Lành has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Lành faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lành hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ehab

texts.en:
Ehab is married and has 2 daughters and one son. He used to work in a medications company but the income was very low and could not cover the monthly expenses of his family, so he started a mobile calls, maintenance, and accessories shop. 

Ehab requested a 10,000 EGP loan to buy new cell phone accessories and spare parts for modern cell phones.

loans.use: To buy new cell phone accessories and spare parts for modern cell phones.

loans.name: Nhóm 17 Chợ Nam Thành, Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has had a retail business selling clothes for more than 10 years. Thủy lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
 
The main hardship that Thủy faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell.
In 2014, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well, for her children to graduate from college, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell, so her children may graduate from college

loans.name: Renalda

texts.en:
Renalda, who is in her early 30s is single with one son who is still at school.  She has been running two projects, a butcher and a grocery store for two years now.  She works from 6.30am to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Renalda's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy two fridges for cooling the drinks, and keeping the meat, increased on the meat stock, the fast moving drinks and has paid back her loans successfully.  

She is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, paid rent for her shop and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase on the meet stock and to buy the fast moving items in the grocery store.  She dreams of making her butchery big.

Renalda will make sure she pays her loan at the scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase on the meat stock and to buy the fast moving items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre, who is a 29 years old married man, lives in the capital of Georgia. He has wife, who is involved in small private trading business and is the only breadwinner in the family. Aleksandre was unable to start any stable job and has a great desire to make his own income. 

To this purpose, he requested a loan. According to above mentioned situation, he lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Aleksandre to get a loan of 1500 GEL and start trading business.

He will purchase stock of shoes and will start selling it with price mark-ups from the local open market. 
This will give him a chance to earn income and become financially independent. With the Start Up program, Aleksandre will be able to make savings and provide a better future for his family.

loans.use: To start his own business and trade in shoes

loans.name: Nhóm 13, Chợ Nam Thành,đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling corn, sweet potato, peanuts for more than 10 years.Hương lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.   Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral cause can't get loan from other banks or credit institutions.

The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase corn, sweet potato, peanuts to resell.

In 2009, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase corn, sweet potato, peanuts to resell on her stall, so as to provide money for her children's education

loans.name: Mansoura

texts.en:
Mansoura is 40 years old from Minia. She is married to a farmer and has 3 daughters and one son. Her husband is the only breadwinner of the family, so Mansoura bought a sewing machine to make clothes for sale to her neighbors' and neighbors children to increase her income for her children. 

Mansoura requested 4000 EGP loan to buy a new sewing machine and cloth for her project.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and cloth for her project.

loans.name: Tsuishitoo Group

texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the ID-Ghana at Teshie-Accra, the Republic of Ghana. Helping to lead a group of three other micro-entrepreneurs, Faustina sells banku (cooked cassava and corn paste), detergent and gari (cassava flour). 

With her tenth loan with ID-Ghana, Faustina will buy more corn  dough, cassava dough (prepare banku and gar), also detergent and sell to customers. In order to keep the best clients, Faustina understands that she must select the highest quality products for her customers and also offer discounts when possible. 

In the future, Faustina would love to expand further up the value chain to sell more therefore asking for this loan. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the this loan.

loans.use: To buy more corn dough, cassava dough (prepared banku and gari), also detergent and sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops for a better harvest for sale in the market so as to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Anita Limbani

texts.es:
Anita tiene 49 años de edad, conviviente, sin hijos, vive en casa propia, domicilio en la AV TARAPACA 1029 - OYOTUN, la cual es una zona rural, de la provincia de Chiclayo, de la region Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Anita Limbani se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(patos, conejos, cuyes, entre otros), desde hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio,con buenas referencias de sus clientes. Anita Limbani solicita préstamo para ampliar su negocio; pues ella necesita realizar la compra de pavos, gallinas, cerdos, cuyes, pichones; el préstamo tendrá la finalidad de incrementar su productividad de los mismos y satisfacer las diversas necesidades y preferencias de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
49-year-old Anita lives with her partner in their own home. They have no children and live in a rural area in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in Peru's north coast. 

Anita works raising and selling animals (ducks, rabbits, guinea pigs, among others). She has had this occupation for 10 years. Her business is located in her home and she has good references from her clients. Anita is requesting this loan to expand her business, as she needs to buy turkeys, hens, pigs, guinea pigs, and pigeons. The loan will allow her to increase her productivity and satisfy her clients' needs and preferences. This will in turn improve her income and profits, as well as her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying small animals for raising and selling.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman with twelve children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Violeta is 50 years old and has seven children who are in school.

Violeta has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 9500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Violeta has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie works hard to support her family. Rosie is married and has a direct selling personal collection, Fullerlife products business in the Philippines.

Rosie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell to her customers.

Rosie has been in this business for 5 years now.

Rosie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 36 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Vivian works very hard to provide for them.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Vivian has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is a Babban Gona farmer from  Bazana II Village. Mathew joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mathew will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Mathew would like to use his extra earnings to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anita is 49 years old and has four children who are in school.

Anita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of clothes to sell.

Anita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudió hasta sexto grado, está felizmente casada, su esposo se dedica al comercio ambulante de hamacas, tiene 4 hijos, pero 3 tienen sus propias familias y hace 3 meses su hijo menor falleció por un problema de salud, sin embargo con la ayuda de Dios ha logrado superar su dolor.

Marta, se dedica a la venta de tortillas en un comal artesanal en su casa todos los días, una de sus hijas y una nuera le ayudan; desde muy temprano se levanta para moler el maíz y proceder a la elaboración de este alimento típico.- Cuando fue joven, trabajó lavando y planchando en diferentes casas, pero luego decidió iniciar su propio negocio y ahora tiene 16 años de dedicarse a este negocio.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar una refrigeradora para su casa, porque no tiene como mantener sus alimentos conservados bajo refrigeración y algunas veces se le arruinan.

El sueño de Marta, es comprar un panel solar, para tener energía electrica en su casa, proque el que tienen no les pertenece.
texts.en:
Marta, 54, is a very hardworking woman.  She studied up to sixth grade.  She's happily married and her husband sells hammocks as a street vendor.  She has four children, but three of them have their own families and her youngest child died three months ago from a health problem.  Nevertheless, with God's help she has managed to overcome her sorrow.

Marta earns a living selling tortillas on a handmade comal [griddle] in her home every day.  One of her daughters and a daughter-in-law help her.  She gets up very early to grind the corn and make this traditional food.  When she was young, she worked washing and ironing clothes in different houses, but then she decided to start her own business.  Now she has been in this business for 16 years.

The requested loan is to buy a refrigerator for her home.  She doesn't have a way to keep her food refrigerated, so sometimes it goes bad.

Marta's dream is to buy a solar panel to have electricity in her house, because the panel she has now doesn't belong to her.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her home

loans.name: Hermisa

texts.en:
Hermisa is a resident in the town of Antequera, Bohol. She is a dealer of Avon products and sells items like beauty products, fashion accessories and apparel. Aside from that, she also engages in selling personal care items like powdered soap, shampoo and lotion. She is a 62 year old married woman with five grown dependents.

Hermisa is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of Avon and Sophie products such as apparel. With these, she will be able to cater to her respective customers and deliver on their orders. Thus, it enables her to improve her income and enables her to settle her obligations.

With these, Hermisa can now start to expand her business and be able to improve the livelihood of the family.


.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of Avon and Sophie products

loans.name: Esther A Group

texts.fr: Mulumba est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Esther A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 53 ans, mère 5 enfants dont 3 mariés et 2 autres ont fini les études. Elle est vendeuse des poissons fumés et salés dans un marché de la ville depuis son jeune âge. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de sa famille. Elle va s’approvisionner en 120 des poissons. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, acheter une parcelle et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mulumba is a saleswoman. She is a member of the Esther A borrowing group, which is a client of IMF Hekima. She is a widow, 53 years old, and the mother of 5 children. Three of her children are married and two others are still in school.

She has been selling smoked and salted fish in the city market starting at a young age. She started her business with funds received from her family. She will buy 120 fish.

She wants to increase her capital, buy a parcel of land, and feed her children. In closing, she thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs not served by the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy 120 fish.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre casado de 65 años de edad, una persona trabajadora, emprendedora, luchadora que vive del campo su actividad principal es lla ganadería centrándose en la rama de lecheros, es padre de 2 hijos, persigue un sueño de tener una granja, un sueño que iba muy bien encaminado hasta que  comenzó el declive del precio de venta de leche el cual lo tiene muy afectado y ha mermado considerablemente las ganancias.

La lechería es una actividad que ha ejercido prácticamente toda su vida, sus padres se la enseñaron y espera que uno de sus hijos mantenga esta tradición familiar por ello no se puede dejar vencer por las circunstancias y quiere luchar contra esta problemática y lo hará solicitando un préstamo para ajustar el dinero para la compra de una vaca lechera en periodo de gestación. 

Apoya a este empresario que ante la problemática busca una solución viable aumentando su producción para regular sus ganancias y permitirse seguir proyectando su sueño de tener una gran de animales.
texts.en:
Carlos is a married man, 65 years old, a hard-working, enterprising, and determined person who lives in the countryside. His primary work is animal husbandry, focusing on dairy production. He is the father of two children and has a dream of having a farm, a dream that was going very well until the decline in the price of milk began, which has affected him a lot and has reduced his earnings considerably. 

Dairy production is work that he has done practically his entire life. His parents taught it to him and he hopes that one of his children will continue with this family tradition, so he can't allow himself to be beaten by the circumstances and he wants to fight against this problem and he will do it by asking for a loan to cover the rest of the cost to purchase a dairy cow in the gestation period. 

Support his businessman who, faced with a difficulty, seeks a viable solution increasing his production to stabilize his earnings and permit him to continue working toward his dream of having a farm of animals.

loans.use: to cover the rest of the cost of purchasing a dairy cow in the gestation period.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en: Kabiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Yanoko Village. Kabiru joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Kabiru suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Kabiru has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seed that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 70 bags of maize this year, Kabiru can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Auwal

texts.en: Auwal is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Yanoko Village. Auwal joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having enough income to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Auwal will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare,more than double the national average of 14 bags per hectare. With increased yields and income, Auwal has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Atitecas Santiago Group

texts.en:
Tucked away in a pocket of Lake Atitlan rests the city of Santiago Atitlan. The Friendship Bridge trust bank Atitecas Santiago consists of 10 women who meet at Friendship Bridge’s communal bank.
Juana is the group's elected president. Juana is a single 26-year-old business woman who specializes in the sale of huipiles (traditional blouse that indigenous women wear in Guatemala). Having been with Friendship Bridge for one loan, Juana has much to be grateful for but she still needs to grow her business. That is why she is requesting a new loan to buy a variety of threads and equipment that she would have been otherwise unable to purchase. Juana has high hopes and dreams that she is confident will come true with hard work and the monetary help provided by Friendship Bridge’s loan program. 
As a part of Friendship Bridge’s Microcredit plus program, Juana and her fellow clients of Friendship Bridge receive a monthly educational session that touches on all aspects of self-development and empowerment.  This program allows Juana, the women of Atitecas Santiago, and other communal groups to grow both as an entrepreneur and also increase their knowledge on topics like health, business, family, and specific topics about women.
The trust bank “Atitecas Santiago” appreciates the confidence of Kiva investors around the world for giving them the opportunity to pursue development for their small businesses through microcredit.

loans.use: to buy a variety of thread and equipment for her textiles business.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is 60 years old and he attends a grocery store. Andres is married and his wife helps him at the grocery store; they work from Monday to Sunday from 7:00 until 21:00. 

Andres needs a loan to buy products for his grocery store. He would like to buy oil, sodas and groceries; he hopes you can help him again. 

Andres is not working as a driver because he thinks he can make more money working with his wife. Andres is in the picture with his wife.

loans.use: to buy oil, sodas and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to be able to pay a postgraduate program and get her professional degree in the career of accounting and, in this way, improve herself.

loans.name: Las Esteli De San Lucas Group

texts.en:
On the southeastern shores of beautiful Lake Atitlan is the town of San Lucas Toliman. The town and its indigenous Kakchiquel-speaking Maya live at the base of the Toliman volcano.  The majority of the women continue to proudly wear their traditional clothing of a beautifully embroidered “huipil” (blouse), intricately woven “faja” (belt) and “corte” (woven wrap-around skirt).  The seven women who make up the Friendship Bridge trust bank “Las Esteli San Lucas” live and work here. They have great hopes for expanding their small businesses, educating their children and raising their standard of living.

One of the youngest members of the trust bank is 23-year-old Heidy, who is single and the president of the group.  For the past two years, Heidy has been selling cosmetics.  Little by little her business has been growing enough so that she is able to continue her study of nursing at the university as well as to help with her family’s income.  Heidy is requesting a loan in order to buy more cosmetics, including creams, shampoos, cases of makeup, deodorants, and lotions.  All of these cosmetic items are in great demand right now!

Heidy and the women of “Las Esteli San Lucas” are grateful for the loans but are also very appreciative to be able to participate in the non-formal education portion of their monthly meetings. They learn about many important and useful subjects like health and hygiene, nutrition and the use of medicinal plants as well as teenage pregnancy and women’s rights. They also gain valuable business tools. These topics not only strengthen their own lives but help their economic growth. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

“Mil gracias” (A thousand thanks) to Kiva lenders for being such an important part of the growth of these women! You are very much appreciated!

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics including creams, shampoos, cases of makeup, deodorants, and lotions

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and married with 9 children, 3 of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, coffee, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for 22 years. 

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, coffee, etc

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal and firewood business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of charcoal and firewood to sell.

Julie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 39 years old, and married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a weaving and selling basket business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave and sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for five years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, propane gas, firewood and lime powder; she will have the raw material to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María, práctica el cultivo de maíz y frijol, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y dos hijos, su compañero de vida es empleado en una empresa de seguridad y sus hijos estudian, no cuentan con apoyo económico del extranjero. María se dedica a la agricultura desde hace cinco años, específicamente cultiva maíz y frijol, inicio su negocio con fondos propios y cultivaba un área pequeña de tierra, actualmente se apoya en créditos para cultivar dos manzanas de terreno.
Cuenta con una parte de los materiales para realizar sus actividades agrícolas pero no son suficientes, por tal razón solicita ayuda con un crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas y herbicidas, además costeara los gastos de preparación del terreno para sembrar maíz, espera que la cosecha sea abundante y que pueda tener mejores ganancias para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
La visión de María es tener mejores cosechas, cancelar la deuda y almacenar parte de los granos para consumo familiar.
texts.en:
María grows corn and beans. She lives in her own house with her life partner and two children. Her life partner is employed in a security business and their children are in school. They don't have any economic support from abroad. María has worked in agriculture for the past five years, specifically she grows corn and beans. She began her business with her own funds and planted a small area of land. Currently, she supports herself with loans to cultivate two manzanas [larger plots] of land.  

She has part of the materials to do the farmwork, but they aren't enough, so she asks for help with a loan to purchase manure, insecticides and herbicides. In addition, she will pay the costs of preparing the land to plant corn, she hopes that the harvest will be abundant and that she will be able to have more earnings to fulfill her obligations. 

María's vision is to have better harvests, pay off the debt and store some of the grains for family consumption.

loans.use: to purchase manure, insecticides and herbicides; in addition she will pay the costs of preparing the land to plant corn.

loans.name: Alexis Mauricio

texts.es:
Alexis es un hombre trabajador, comprometido que se dedica a la confección, estampación, sublimación y distribución de su propia línea de ropa, esta persona realiza todo el proceso en su hogar, inicio con su negocio con un único objetivo de comprar una vivienda propia y sigue trabajando con mucho empeño para lograr este gran objetivo y que quiere dárselo a su madre por agradecimiento de todo lo que ha hecho y hará por él.

Para mejorar su proceso y ahorrar los cotos de producción el señor Alexis se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual quiere destinar en la compra de una maquina sublimadora para finalizar el proceso de estampación, su meta es hacer que su marca llegue a los centros comerciales, mientras se preocupa por estudiar el mercado y sacar algo diferente que impacte y agrade el mercado.

Tu préstamo le dará la oportunidad al señor Alexis te tener en su casa toda la maquinaria para realizar el proceso de estampación y confección de una camiseta.
texts.en:
Alexis is a hard working man, he is committed to tailoring, screen printing and distributing his own line of clothing. 

Alexis completes the entire process in his home, he started his business with the sole objective of buying his own home. He continues to work hard to achieve his goal. He wants to show his mother his appreciation for everything she has done and continues to do for him. 

In order to improve his production process and lower costs, Alexis is seeking a loan to use to buy a screen printing machine to finalize the printing process. 

Alexis's goal is to see his clothing brand enter commercial centers, so he is studying the market to offer something different that the market will respond well to. 

Your loan will give Alexis the opportunity to have in his home all the equipment necessary to tailor and print a t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy a screen printing machine to make a clothing line

loans.name: Theonna

texts.en: Eight years ago, Theonna decided to act upon an idea she had in college when her class was asked to come up with a business plan. She had grown up reading books, so a book-selling business aligned perfectly with her passion. She sells mostly non-fiction books. Her business has experienced a lot of growth in the last few years, so she plans to use this loan to increase inventory and cover shipping costs. She works extremely hard in order to create a thriving business that her children can one day inherit.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her online bookselling business.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio. Ella es emprendedora, amable, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, generosa, alegre, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Sacaba’ ubicado a 25 kilómetros al sur este de la ciudad donde los pobladores se dedican mayormente a actividades agropecuarias, los jóvenes y niños adoptan rápidamente un trabajo para apoyar a sus familias, dejando de lado los estudios. Los trabajos normalmente están relacionados a cuidado de ganado y niñeras o ayudante de albañiles en la ciudad. Dichas actividades son riesgosas y llevan a los niños, niñas y adolescentes a posibles situaciones de explotación laboral. 
Melissa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar fideo, arroz, refrescos, galletas, productos de limpieza, etc., en su tienda de barrio que debido a la falta de comercio en la zona no tiene competencia. Actividad que realiza de forma independiente todos los días de la semana en horario del día, “mi madre me regaló el negocio para que tenga una actividad comercial, mi meta es consolidar mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia en el lugar, la desventaja es la distancia de sus proveedores y de su tienda. Su sueño es abrir una empresa distribuidora para realizar ventas por mayor, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra por mayor de abarrotes y material escolar para la venta en su tienda, ya que existe una escuela cercana y existe demanda de esos productos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Melissa solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes y material escolar para surtir su tienda y con los beneficios convertirse en vendedora mayorista.
texts.en:
Melissa is a young woman who is 19 years of age.  She is single and has no children.  She has a business selling food and consumer staples in her neighborhood store.  She is enterprising and kind, and she has a good attitude and is committed to her work.  She is also generous, cheerful, responsible, and very hardworking.  Her business is located in the town of Sacaba, located 25 kilometers to the south of the city.  Here, the residents work mainly in agriculture. The youths and children leave their studies to work very quickly in order to help support their families.  Generally their work is related to the care of livestock and babysitting, or helping out with construction in the city.  These activities are risky, and they put the boys, girls, and adolescents into possible situations of worker exploitation.

Melissa has a dark complexion, dark eyes, long black hair tied back, a short stature, and a medium physique.  Her native language is Quechua, which she speaks in the place, and she also speaks Spanish in the general culture and in her business.  They live in a home that is her family's property.  It is built with brick and cement and has a tin roof and cement floors.  The house has electricity and well water extracted with an electric pump.  

Melissa has a business selling food and consumer staples such as bread, sugar, noodles, rice, soft drinks, cookies, cleaning products, etc.  Due to the lack of commerce in the area, her neighborhood store has no competition.  She works independently every day of the week on a daily schedule.  "My mother gave me the business so that I could have a commercial activity. My goal is to consolidate my business," she comments. 

The advantage of Melissa's business is the lack of competition in the area.  The disadvantage is that her store is very far from her suppliers.  Her goal is to open a distributorship where she could make her sales at wholesale.  She wants to expand her business by purchasing groceries at wholesale and by purchasing school supplies to sell in her store, because there is a school nearby and so there is demand for these products. This is the first loan she has taken with the institution in the 5 years that she has been developing her business. 

This is why Melissa is requesting a loan to purchase groceries and school supplies to stock her store, so that with the profits she can convert her business into a wholesale distributorship.

loans.use: to buy groceries and school supplies

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, tiene la edad  de 69 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y su hija,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena geminación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones de materia organica del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y durante el desarrollo y cosecha, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la eroción, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Fernando is 69 years of age, is married and lives with his wife and daughter, who are his first priority. With his loan he hopes to purchase high-quality bean seeds that will germinate well, organic fertilizers that will help him to improve the condition of the organic material of his land and other products to use during sowing as well as during growth and the harvest. He also hopes to pay for the labour of preparatory work on the land and other work that will help him ensure that rainwater does not cause damage through erosion, as well as the use of these products and assistance on the farm once there has been some development. With this, he will be sure to do good work.

Fernando is hoping to take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions of the area for this crop, and to put several years of experience in the management of bulk grains to use. He will also be able to buy the best products of the best quality, so that his farm will develop well and healthily in addition to having a sufficient harvest and, in the short term, an important production.

With the income from the harvest he hopes to have, Fernando wants to provide comforts and education to his family, achieve some family goals and continue to invest more in the crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not previously had other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with great ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sow bean plants.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa works hard to support her family. Felisa is married and has a buy-and-sell basket business in the Philippines.

Felisa requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more baskets to sell.

Felisa has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more baskets to sell

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 52 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Eleonor has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Estrella Group

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de pollo frito.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, generosa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por los orígenes de sus pobladores; tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del área e iniciaron la manufactura y el comercio, de clima cálido sub tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Claudia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio que realiza (de pie la primera de la derecha, viste blusa color marrón y blanco). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de continuar con su actividad decidió formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, confección de tejidos, venta de pescado, servicio de limpieza, venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos y venta de ropa de temporada, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de pollo frito, actividad que realiza en un puesto de venta en la calle en diferentes lugares. Su comida está compuesta por trozos de carne de pollo tierno, a veces enharinados o rebozados, y luego fritos. Lo que distingue a su pollo frito de otras frituras de pollo es que habitualmente las corta por las articulaciones, dejando los huesos y la piel intactos. La piel crujiente bien condimentada, sin exceso de grasa, es el rasgo distintivo de su pollo bien frito; “voy a abrir mi puesto de venta fijo, para eso necesito realizar un techo para cubrir del sol y la lluvia a mis clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es una comida rápida que se consume a diario, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la construcción de un techo. Su sueño es abrir un snack de venta de pollo frito, ella desea realizar la construcción de un techo para su nuevo puesto de venta de pollo frito para cubrir a sus clientes de las inclemencias del tiempo. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año y medio que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un techo para su nuevo puesto de venta de pollo frito para cubrir a sus clientes de las inclemencias del tiempo.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 27 year old woman who lives with her partner and has two children ages 5 and 8 years old. Claudia's business is selling fried chicken. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, generous, patient, responsible and hard-working.

She works itinerantly in the Plan 3000 area which is known for the origin of it's inhabitants, Ayoreas tribes, native to the area and miners relocated to the area from the west. They settled in the area and started manufacturing and commerce. It is a hot, very humid, sub-tropical climate with a daily temperature that varies between 21 to 35 degrees Celsius.

Claudia is dark-skinned, dark eyes, and has long dark hair that she ties back at her neck, is short in stature and of medium build. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (She is the first one who is stand up to the right in the photo wearing a brown and white blouse).

She shares her life with her partner, who works, and her children, who study at school. Her children are independent and have their own families. She lives in her own house made of cement and bricks with a metal roof and brick floor which has running water, electricity and sewage.

Due to her need to continue with her business she decided to form a communal bank with people with businesses like; second-hand clothing sales, selling fruit, selling tomatoes, knitting, selling fish, a cleaning service, selling empanadas, selling cosmetics and selling seasonal clothing to request a loan and improve their businesses.

Her business is selling fried chicken, a business she does at a sales stand in the street in different locations. Her food is composed of pieces of meat from young chickens, sometimes in flour or in batter and fries. What distinguishes her chicken from others is that she normally cuts them at the joints leaving the bones and skin intact. The well-seasoned, crusty skin, low in fat is the distinction of her chicken. "I am going to open a fixed stand and to do this I need a roof to protect my clients from the sun and rain", she commented.

The advantage of her business is that it is a fast food that people consume daily, her disadvantage is the lack of capital to build her roof. Her dream is to open a fried chicken snack shop. This is her first loan with the institution in the year and a half she has been in this business. For these reasons Claudia is requesting a loan to build a roof over her new fried chicken stand to protect her clients from inclement weather.

loans.use: to build a roof over her new fried chicken stand to protect her clients from inclement weather.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is married and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as T-shirts, pants, blouses, etc.

Melanie has been in this business for 27 years now.

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as T-shirts, pants, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Virgie is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.

Virgie has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Virgie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Gina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional packs of frozen foods to sell in her buy-and-sell frozen foods business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional packs of frozen items to sell

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad works hard to support her family. Soledad is single and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Soledad has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Soledad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Joyralyn

texts.en:
Joyralyn is 42 years old and married, with three children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Joyralyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, chips, bread, and noodles.

Joyralyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Joyralyn would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, chips, bread, and noodles.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 43 years old and married, with six children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmela runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like chips, bread, soap, milk, and canned goods.

Carmela has been in this business for four years. In the future, Carmela would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like chips, bread, soap, milk, and canned goods.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her buy-and-sell livestock.

Aida dreams that, one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Wilfer Adolfo

texts.es:
Wilfer es un hombre emprendedor, trabajando, honrado, humilde, una persona enfocada y mentalizada en mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
Wilfer inicio con su negocio de confección a terceros en el año 1995, genera 5 empleos y buena estabilidad a su familia, este personaje de 41 años de edad no se quiere detener y conformarse con lo que ha logrado hasta el momento por ello solicita su apoyo y quiere que apoyen a un empresario que empezó con una maquina prestada y ahora produce una importante cantidad de surtido.

El apoyo que solicita Wilfer es para la compra de una maquina recubridora con la que agilizara los tiempo de producción, sacando un mayor número de jeans diarios, garantizando y mejorando los tiempos de entrega de pedidos.
texts.en:
Wilfer is a hardworking man, honorable, humble, and focused on improving his living conditions. 

Wilfer started his business making clothes in 1995, he now has five employees and a stable family life. At the age of 41, Wilfer doesn't want to slow down or stop growing. That's why he's looking for people to support a businessman who started with a borrowed machine and now produces an impressive array of merchandise. 

Wilfer is seeking a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to speed up production time. This would allow him to produce more jeans on a daily basis, guaranteeing and improving upon his ability to deliver orders.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine to speed up jeans production time

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Tân Nam, Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ty is 64 years old and she is married. She is a member of Nhom 03 Tan Nam, Nam Ngan Group. 

She has had a retail business, selling chairs for five years. Tỵ lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family has a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Tỵ faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chairs to sell.

In 2009, Tỵ joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Tỵ has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. When she had not yet gotten a loan, she had few chairs to sell. With the loan, her store now has many kinds of chairs, her income is also improved.

With her business profit, Tỵ hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more chairs to sell.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: Adán de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos  se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa en casa propia, Adan está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Adan, who's 41 years old, lives in a house of his own with his wife and two kids.  He has been working in agriculture for 20 years, planting corn and vegetables.  He sells his produce in the various markets near his house.  

Adan is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pesticides, etc. and to improve the land shown in the picture to be able to continue with his work and have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pesticides, etc. and improve his land

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  agradece mucho el apoyo que se le brindo con el crédito anterior pues gracias a ello él pudo realizar la inversión en su venta de banano por lo que afortunadamente ahora ya cuenta con mucho más clientes y sus ingresos han mejorado, Manuel nuevamente solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más bananos por quintal y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de Manuel es poder construir una casa de block donde pueda acoger con mas comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Manuel appreciates the support that was provided to him with his previous loan.  Thanks to the loan, he was able to make an investment in his business selling bananas.  Fortunately, he now has many more customers and his income has increased.  Manuel is requesting a new loan to buy bananas by the hundred-weight so that he can better satisfy the needs of his customers.  Manuel's greatest dream is to be able to build a cement block home where he could shelter his family more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy and sell bananas

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Andres es un hombre de 25 años de edad, una persona del campo que aprendió del negocio de cría de cerdos gracias a sus padres y que decidió emprender su propio camino para generar mayores ingresos que le permitieran comprar sus propios activos como casa, o una granja que sería su gran sueño.

Andres a pesar de ser una persona del campo no se olvida del estudio no quiere ser un simple empresario con conocimientos empíricos, quiere ser universitario y apoyar su labor con conocimientos que traspasen las barreras del conocimiento empírico que ha rodeado su región por tantos años.

Para poder estudiar Andres necesita aumentar su capital para pagar la matricula y sostener los diferentes gastos, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para aumentar la producción y lo invertirá en la compra de 5 lechones y alimento que a futuro representaran una excelente ganancia y soporte para su matrícula del primer periodo del año  2016.
texts.en:
Andres is a 25-year-old man who is from the countryside and learned the business of raising pigs thanks to his parents. He decided to go his own way so as to generate a greater income that will permit him to buy his own assets, such as a house, or a farm, which is his biggest dream.

Despite being from the countryside, Andres has not forgotten about his studies. He doesn't want to be a simple businessman with only empirical knowledge, he wants to become a university student and to improve his livelihood with knowledge that goes beyond the barriers of the empirical knowledge that has been prevalent in the region he lives in for many years.

To be able to study, Andres needs to increase his capital so that he can pay for tuition, as well as other expenses. Due to this, he requests a loan to increase his production, and will invest it in the purchase of 5 suckling pigs and feed. In the future, this will represent a great gain and will support him so he can pay the tuition for the first school period of 2016.

loans.use: to purchase 5 suckling pigs and feed.

loans.name: Gerber Angel

texts.es:
Gerber, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, ya no pudo seguir estudiando debido al conflicto armado que sufrió el país y sus padres tuvieron que emigrar hacia otro pueblo en los años ochenta; luego con el tiempo sus padres y sus hermanos emigraron al extranjero; Gerber, está acompañado desde hace siete años, tiene una niña de 6 años de edad y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también hace venta de pan y de otros antojitos para apoyar a su familia. 

Gerber, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, es ayudante de albañil y realiza diferentes oficios de donde obtiene ingresos para el sustento de su familia; estuvo por varios años en el extranjero pero por problemas lo enviaron nuevamente al país, cuando estuvo en el extranjero trabajo de cocinero.- Ahora, vende hog-dog, hamburguesas y tacos desde las 3 de la tarde, hasta las 8 de la noche, en el parque de la comunidad y su esposa le apoya a hacer los preparativos para ir al puesto en el parque.

Gerber, solicita un crédito para comprar un canopy, sillas y mesas, para ponerlos en el lugar donde le dio la oportunidad de poner su negocio la alcaldía de la comunidad.- De esta manera podrá tener un local en mejores condiciones y ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes. 

El sueño de Gerber, es tener un local propio para vender sus antojitos y poner un comedor, pues es un negocio rentable.
texts.en:
Gerber, age 32, went to school through the seventh grade.  He was not able to continue going to school because of the armed conflict that his country suffered through.  In the 80’s his parents had to move to another town.  Then, in time, his parents and his siblings moved abroad.

Gerber has been in a relationship for seven years, and he has a six year old daughter.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores, and she also sells bread and other food in order to support her family.

Gerber works in agriculture, he is an assistant bricklayer, and he does other jobs where he can get income for his family’s sustenance.  He was abroad for several years, but they sent him to his country again because of problems.  When he was abroad he worked as a cook.  Now he sells hot dogs, hamburgers, and tacos from three in the afternoon until eight at night.  He sells in the community park, and his wife helps him with the preparations to go to his stand at the park.

Gerber is requesting a loan to buy a canopy, chairs, and tables for his place, where the community government gave him the chance to set up his business.  This way he will be able to have a place in better condition, and he will sell his products to his customers.

Gerber’s dream is to have his own place to sell his food and to set up an eatery.  It is a profitable business.

loans.use: to buy a canopy, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: Yolan

texts.es: Yolan, tiene la edad  de 36 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y su hija,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena geminación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la eroción, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yolan is 36 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and daughter, who are his top priority. He would use the loan to buy good quality bean seed that germinate well, as well as to purchase organic fertilizers that will help to improve the soil conditions and other products for the crop. In addition to this, he will use the loan to pay for the labor needed to prepare the land, and other jobs that will help so that the rain water doesn't cause erosion damages, as well as for the application of the products and planting assistance once the crop develops. By doing so, he would make certain that the job is done well.

He wishes to make the most out of the region's good conditions for this crop, as well as to put into practice his several years of experience in the handling of basic grains. He also wants to be able to buy better quality products so that his crop has a good development and health, as well as an adequate harvest, and to have an important short-term production.

He wants to use the income he hopes the harvest will generate for the well-being and education of his family, and to accomplish some of the family goals, as well as to continue investing in his crops.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Before this, he had not had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan with more services and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase quality bean seed, organic fertilizer, and other products for the development of his crop, as well as to pay for the labor and assistance.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado en su comunidad, se ha dedicado a los trabajos de la agricultura, también de ayudante de albañil con su padre y trabajo durante dos años en una empresa de construcción, donde conoció a su esposa, con quien ahora tiene un niño de 10 años de edad y su esposa trabaja elaborando hamacas y de esa manera ayuda económicamente en el hogar.

Julio, se dedica a elaborar hamacas de hilo de seda desde hace 11 años, su esposa le enseño el arte y decidió dedicarse a este rubro debido a la demanda que hay en la zona y que es rentable, también trabaja en la agricultura y en la albañilería cuando hay proyectos en la zona.

Julio, necesita el dinero para comprar 200 libras de hilo, comprar guarda cabos y cortinas para las hamacas, con ello pretende aumentar su volumen de producción y obtener mayores ingresos económicos.- El resto del dinero lo necesita para comprar cuatro cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos en la comunidad. 

El sueña con seguir trabajando en las artesanías, darle el estudio a su hijo y también mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julio is 30 years old and attended school through the second grade in his community. He was a farmer and also helped his father, a bricklayer. He worked for two years in the employ of a construction company, where he met his wife. They now have a 10-year-old son. His wife is a weaver who makes hammocks, thus contributing to household expenses. 

Julio also weaves hammocks out of silken strands. He started eleven years ago; he learned the trade from his spouse. He decided to become a weaver because there is a lot of demand for their product in the area and it is thus a profitable business.  He also works in agriculture and construction when there are projects in the area.

Julio needs the loan to buy a 200 pounds of hammock yarn, and metal rings and awnings for the hammocks.  With this investment, he plans to increase the volume of his production so that he can obtain greater earnings.  With the rest of the money, he plans to buy 4 pigs to fatten and later sell in the community.  He dreams of continuing to work in handicrafts so that he can provide his son with an education and also improve his house.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make hammocks

loans.name: Esteban Gerardo

texts.es: Esteban Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está en unión libre, vive con su esposa, la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena geminación y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno a sembrar y para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Esteban Gerardo, who is 26 years old, lives in common-law marriage with his wife, who is his top priority. He would use the loan to buy good quality bean seed that germinate well, as well as to purchase organic fertilizers that will help to improve the soil conditions and other products for the crop. In addition to this, he will use the loan to pay for the labor needed to prepare the land, and other jobs that will help so that the rain water doesn't cause erosion damages, as well as for the application of the products and planting assistance once the crop develops. By doing so, he would make certain that the job is done well.

He wishes to make the most out of the region's good conditions for this crop, as well as to put into practice his several years of experience in the handling of basic grains. He also wants to be able to buy better quality products so that his crop has a good development and health, as well as an adequate harvest, and to have an important short-term production.

He wants to use the income he hopes the harvest will generate for the well-being and education of his family, and to accomplish some of the family goals, as well as to continue investing in his crops.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Before this, he had not had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan with more services and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase quality bean seeds, fertilizers, and other products for the development of his crop, as well as to pay for the labor and assistance.

loans.name: 05 Thôn Ngọ Tiến Lộc Group

texts.en:
Ms Hồng has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

Hồng is 25 years old and she is single with no children. Hồng is the group leader of the 05 Thôn Ngọ Tiến Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Hồng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods and sell.

loans.name: Buhari

texts.en: Buhari is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Badamasi Village. Buhari joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Buhari will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Buhari now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to diversify his farms and grow other crops.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Philibus Maigemu

texts.en: Philibus Maigemu is a Babban Gona farmer from Bazana II Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Philibus Maigemu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to repair his house. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Philibus Maigemu has ambitious plans to harvest 80  bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Philibus Maigemu now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: 04 - Bào Ngoại - Đông Hương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa is 49 years old and is married with two children. One of two dependent children is congenitally deaf and dumb.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years. Now she needs more capital to expand to sell some kinds of seafood to raise income. Hoa lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable. 

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and seafood to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 15 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sâm is 28 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for seven years. Sâm lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Sâm faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

This is Sâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.With her business profit, Sâm hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 9 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Ms Đức is 51 years old and she is a single parent with two children. She has had a retail business selling cake, sweet, sugar, and milk for more than 10 years. Đức lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Đức faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweet, sugar, and milk to resell.

In 2014, Đức joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Đức has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Đức hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweet, sugar, and milk to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 04 - Khu Phố 3- Đông Sơn -  Bỉm Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thiều works in agriculture planting orchids. She is applying for a loan to purchase more supplies to plant orchids for sale. She lives and works in Bim Son district, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She is a low-income household in her village. 

In 2015, Thiều joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thiều has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.With her business profit, Thiều hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to plant orchids for sale

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara works hard to support her family. Clara is married and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines.

Clara requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like shirts, shorts, etc. to sell.

Clara has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Clara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like shirts, shorts, etc. to sell
